original: de rgyas par bshad pa dus sbyor 'char ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyas par bshad pa dus sbyor 'char ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The extensive explanation of that is “the rising of the ascendant,” and so on.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dag mnyam par 'bab pa'i phyir mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dag mnyam par 'bab pa'i phyir mnyam pa'o //
translated: The moon and sun are equal because they rise equally.

original: mnyam pa'i grangs gsungs pa /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i grangs gsungs pa /
translated: The number of the equal is stated:

original: rkang pa dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rkang pa dang bcas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “with the foot,” and so on.

original: dus sbyor gcig 'char ba'i mngon mtshams su 'jug pa dang 'byung bdag gcig tu byas pa la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu rtsa drug 'bab po //
analyzed: dus sbyor gcig 'char ba'i mngon mtshams su 'jug pa dang 'byung bdag gcig tu byas pa la rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu rtsa drug 'bab po //
translated: In the ascendant of one ascendant, the entry and the lord of the element are counted as one, and fifty-six with the foot fall.

original: de bzhin du nyin mtshan gyi dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyi mtshams su 'byung ba dang 'jug pa bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i drug brgya 'bab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin mtshan gyi dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyi mtshams su 'byung ba dang 'jug pa bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i drug brgya 'bab bo //
translated: In the same way, in the twelve ascendants of day and night, the element and the entry are counted as one, and six hundred plus seventy-five fall.

original: @264b sems can thams cad kyi lus la dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i drug brgya'o //
analyzed: @264b sems can thams cad kyi lus la dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i drug brgya'o //
translated: In the body of all sentient beings, twenty-one thousand plus six hundred plus seventy-five fall.

original: 'dis dman pa gang yin pa de rnams la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ra 'bab po //
analyzed: 'dis dman pa gang yin pa de rnams la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ra 'bab po //
translated: Those who are inferior to this have the fall of lagnas and rasas.

original: nyin zhag so sor dbu ma'i dbugs bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i drug brgya po rnams lo brgya'i nyin zhag stong phrag sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis bsgyur te de las nyin zhag gi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams kyis bgos pas🔽thob pa nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig rnams so //
analyzed: nyin zhag so sor dbu ma'i dbugs bdun cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i drug brgya po rnams lo brgya'i nyin zhag stong phrag sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis bsgyur te de las nyin zhag gi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams kyis bgos pas thob pa nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i brgya phrag bcu gcig rnams so //
translated: In each day, there are 667 breaths in the central channel. Multiplying that by the 36,525 days in a hundred years, there are 2,495,812,500 breaths in a hundred years.🔽Dividing that by the 21,600 breaths in a day, there are 116,666.66 days.

original: de rnams kyang lo'i nyin zhag drug cu lhag pa'i sum brgya rnams kyis rnam par phye bas phyogs gsum lhag pa'i lo gsum rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang lo'i nyin zhag drug cu lhag pa'i sum brgya rnams kyis rnam par phye bas phyogs gsum lhag pa'i lo gsum rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Dividing that by the 360 days in a year, there are 323.55 years.

original: steng du g-yon pa gang yin pa de nyid zla ba dang brkyang ma dang lug dang chu 'bab pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: steng du g-yon pa gang yin pa de nyid zla ba dang brkyang ma dang lug dang chu 'bab pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The left channel above is the moon, the lalanā, Aries, and the descending flow, the nature of the tathāgata Amitābha.

original: g-yas pa ni nyi ma dang ser skya dang gzhan zhes pa ro ma dang me 'bab pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni nyi ma dang ser skya dang gzhan zhes pa ro ma dang me 'bab pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The right channel is the sun, yellow, and the other, the rasanā, which is the flow of fire, the nature of Ratnasambhava.

original: 'og tu dbu ma bshad pa'i rtsa dang sa 'bab pa ste rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og tu dbu ma bshad pa'i rtsa dang sa 'bab pa ste rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The central channel below, explained as the path of the moon, is the flow of earth, the nature of Vairocana.

original: g-yon pa ni gci ba'i rtsa dang rlung 'bab pa ste don yod brub pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni gci ba'i rtsa dang rlung 'bab pa ste don yod brub pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The left channel is the flow of urine and wind, the nature of Amoghasiddhi.

original: steng du dbu ma sgra gcan gyi rtsa dang stong pa 'bab ba ste mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: steng du dbu ma sgra gcan gyi rtsa dang stong pa 'bab ba ste mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The central channel above, the path of Rāhu, is the flow of space, the nature of Akṣobhya.

original: de nyid 'og tu g-yas pa khu ba'i rtsa dang ye shes 'bab pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'og tu g-yas pa khu ba'i rtsa dang ye shes 'bab pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That same [central channel] below, the right channel of semen, is the flow of gnosis, the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: bshang ba'i rtsa steng du zla ba'i lam dang lhan cig gcig tu 'gyur te bug pa gcig pa'i phyi rol de bzhin du gci ba'i rtsa nyi ma dang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshang ba'i rtsa steng du zla ba'i lam dang lhan cig gcig tu 'gyur te bug pa gcig pa'i phyi rol de bzhin du gci ba'i rtsa nyi ma dang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The path of the feces channel above becomes one with the path of the moon, a single opening. Likewise, the path of the urine channel becomes one with the sun.

original: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i dus bzhir khu ba la 'bab ma sgra gcan dang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i dus bzhir khu ba la 'bab ma sgra gcan dang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in the four times of birth and so on, the semen flows down.

original: lte ba'i steng du kun 'dar ma gang yin pa de'i ming gnyis te yid bzang ma dang mun pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i steng du kun 'dar ma gang yin pa de'i ming gnyis te yid bzang ma dang mun pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: The one above the navel is called the two names, Bhadrā and Tamobhaginī.

original: 'og tu khu ba 'bab ma gang yin pa de'i yang ming gnyis te mkha' 'gro gdong ma dang dung can ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'og tu khu ba 'bab ma gang yin pa de'i yang ming gnyis te mkha' 'gro gdong ma dang dung can ma zhes pa'o //
translated: The one below, the semen-flow, is also called the two names, Dākinīmukha and Śankhinī.

original: lte ba la sogs pa 'dab ma lnga'i lte ba rnams su aa wa dh'u t'ir son pa'i srog gi nus pa sa la sogs pa'i khams lnga rnams 'bab pa'i rim pas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lte ba la sogs pa 'dab ma lnga'i lte ba rnams su aa wa dh'u t'ir son pa'i srog gi nus pa sa la sogs pa'i khams lnga rnams 'bab pa'i rim pas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the centers of the five petals such as the navel, the power of the life-force located in the avadhūti flows down in the order of the five elements such as earth.🔽There, in the lotus of the navel, the five qualities of earth are smell, form, taste, touch, and sound.

original: de la lte ba'i chu skyes la sa'i yon tan lnga ste dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams so //🔽snying @265a * //
analyzed: de la lte ba'i chu skyes la sa'i yon tan lnga ste dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams so //🔽snying @265a * //
translated: In the heart, the five qualities of water are sound, form, taste, touch, and taste.🔽In the throat, the five qualities of fire are sound, form, taste, touch, and form.🔽In the head, the five qualities of wind are sound, touch, touch, touch, and touch.🔽In the secret place, the five qualities of space are sound, form, taste, touch, and smell.

original: ga'i chu skyes la chu'i yon tan bzhi ste gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: ga'i chu skyes la chu'i yon tan bzhi ste gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The four qualities of water are in the lotus of the navel: the characteristics of form, taste, touch, and sound.

original: mgrin pa'i chu skyes la me'i yon tan gsum ste ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i chu skyes la me'i yon tan gsum ste ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The three qualities of fire are in the lotus of the throat: taste, touch, and sound.

original: dpral ba'i chu skyes la rlung gi yon tan gnyis te reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: dpral ba'i chu skyes la rlung gi yon tan gnyis te reg bya dang sgra'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: The two qualities of wind are in the lotus of the forehead: touch and sound.

original: gtsug tor gyi chu skyes la stong pa'i yon tan gcig ste sgra tsam mo //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi chu skyes la stong pa'i yon tan gcig ste sgra tsam mo //
translated: The one quality of space is in the lotus of the crown: sound alone.

original: 'di rnams bzung nas aa wa dh'u t'i 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams bzung nas aa wa dh'u t'i 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having grasped these, they enter the avadhūti.

original: sdud pas zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sdud pas zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By the process of “contraction” and so on.

original: de 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /🔽sa yi khams ni chu la thim //
analyzed: de 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa / sa yi khams ni chu la thim //
translated: Āryadeva’s statement is:🔽The earth element dissolves into water.

original: chu ni me la thim par 'gyur //
analyzed: chu ni me la thim par 'gyur //
translated: Water dissolves into fire.

original: me ni phra mo'i khams la'o //🔽rlung yang sems la thim par 'gyur //
analyzed: me ni phra mo'i khams la'o // rlung yang sems la thim par 'gyur //
translated: Fire dissolves into the subtle element.🔽Wind dissolves into mind.

original: sems ni sems byung la thim 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni sems byung la thim 'gyur //
translated: Mind dissolves into mental factors.

original: sems byung ma rig pa la ste //
analyzed: sems byung ma rig pa la ste //
translated: Mental factors dissolve into ignorance.

original: de yang 'od gsal ba ru 'gro //
analyzed: de yang 'od gsal ba ru 'gro //
translated: and that becomes clear light.

original: 'di ni srid pa gsum du 'gag / ces ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa gsum du 'gag / ces ba ste /
translated: This is the cessation in the three existences.

original: rlung phyi rol du 'bab pas khams zad pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: rlung phyi rol du 'bab pas khams zad pa'i yang ngo //
translated: Because the wind moves outside, the elements are exhausted.

original: de ni 'jug pa dag slar yang gtsug tor gyi padma la sogs pa'i rim pas sa la ste lte ba'i padma la 'jug ste ni 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa dag slar yang gtsug tor gyi padma la sogs pa'i rim pas sa la ste lte ba'i padma la 'jug ste ni 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the entering wind again enters the earth through the stages of the crown lotus and so on, that is, it enters the navel lotus.

original: skyed pas ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: skyed pas ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Generation is through the stages of space and so on.

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Āryadeva also says:

original: 'od gsal las ni stong pa che //
analyzed: 'od gsal las ni stong pa che //
translated: From clear light, great emptiness.

original: stong pa las kyang thabs byung ngo //
analyzed: stong pa las kyang thabs byung ngo //
translated: From emptiness, the method arises.

original: de las shes rab skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las shes rab skye bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, wisdom is born.

original: de las rlung ni yang dag 'byung //🔽rlung las me ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las rlung ni yang dag 'byung // rlung las me ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, wind arises.🔽From wind, fire arises.

original: me las chu ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: me las chu ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: From fire, water arises.

original: chu las kyang ni sa skyes 'gyur //
analyzed: chu las kyang ni sa skyes 'gyur //
translated: From water, earth is born.

original: 'di ni sems can rnams 'byung ba'o //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sems can rnams 'byung ba'o // zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the birth of sentient beings.

original: nang du 'bab pas las kyi khams 'phel ba'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: nang du 'bab pas las kyi khams 'phel ba'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: Because the wind moves inside, the elements increase.

original: de ltar aa wa dh'u t'ir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba na lte ba nas lte ba'i dbus su yin gyi yongs su lhag par 'gyur ba'i phyir la la n'a dag gi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la 'gro ba dang 'od ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar aa wa dh'u t'ir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba na lte ba nas lte ba'i dbus su yin gyi yongs su lhag par 'gyur ba'i phyir la la n'a dag gi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la 'gro ba dang 'od ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when the wind moves in and out of the avadhūtī, it is in the center of the navel, not in the petals of the navel lotus.

original: 'og tu lte gsang nor bu'i chu skyes la /
analyzed: 'og tu lte gsang nor bu'i chu skyes la /
translated: Below, in the secret and jewel lotuses,

original: dung can ma'i lus ngag sems rnams 'bab pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas yon tan gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi bdag nyid sdud pa'i rim pas 'byung ba dang skyed pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dung can ma'i lus ngag sems rnams 'bab pa ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas yon tan gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi bdag nyid sdud pa'i rim pas 'byung ba dang skyed pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: the body, speech, and mind of the conch-bearer descend, and the three qualities, two qualities, and one quality are withdrawn in the order of their production and generation.

original: dung can ma @265b 'di nyid bud med bde ba las te shin tu dga' ba chags pa'i bde ba las khu ba 'bab bo //
analyzed: dung can ma @265b 'di nyid bud med bde ba las te shin tu dga' ba chags pa'i bde ba las khu ba 'bab bo //
translated: From the pleasure of the woman, from the pleasure of passion, the semen descends in the conch-bearer.

original: dus rtag tu sde rdul 'byung ba'i dus su de nyid khrag 'bab bo //
analyzed: dus rtag tu sde rdul 'byung ba'i dus su de nyid khrag 'bab bo //
translated: Always, when the emission of semen occurs, blood descends in the conch-bearer.

original: nub dang shar du zhes pa la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba shes rab dang thabs 'khyud pa'i mdor bstan pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nub dang shar du zhes pa la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba shes rab dang thabs 'khyud pa'i mdor bstan pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the west and east, etc., is the brief indication of the embrace of wisdom and means, which will be explained by the words “wisdom” and so on.

original: steng du srog la g-yas dang g-yon dag ste g-yas dang g-yon pa dang shes rab thabs dang dngos yan lag go //
analyzed: steng du srog la g-yas dang g-yon dag ste g-yas dang g-yon pa dang shes rab thabs dang dngos yan lag go //
translated: Above, in the life-force channel, are the right and left, the right and left wisdom and means, the real limbs.

original: 'og tu thur sel la g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag go //
analyzed: 'og tu thur sel la g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag go //
translated: Below, in the evacuative channel, are the right and left.

original: 'og dang steng du rdul dang khu ba 'bab pa dag go //
analyzed: 'og dang steng du rdul dang khu ba 'bab pa dag go //
translated: Below and above, the descent of the semen and blood.

original: bud med rnams kyi dung can ma nying rdul gyi dus su rdul 'bab pa'i phyir gtum mo zhes brjod de de nyid khu ba 'bab pa'i phyir mkha' 'gro gdong ma'o //
analyzed: bud med rnams kyi dung can ma nying rdul gyi dus su rdul 'bab pa'i phyir gtum mo zhes brjod de de nyid khu ba 'bab pa'i phyir mkha' 'gro gdong ma'o //
translated: In women, the conch-bearer channel is called “fierce” because at the time of menstruation, blood descends. It is called “ḍākinī-mukha” because it is the descent of semen.

original: steng du bud med rnams kyi aa wa dh'u t'i'i dus su ste rdul gyi dus su rdul 'bab pa'i phyir g-yung mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: steng du bud med rnams kyi aa wa dh'u t'i'i dus su ste rdul gyi dus su rdul 'bab pa'i phyir g-yung mo zhes brjod do //
translated: Above, in women, at the time of the avadhūti, because at the time of menstruation, blood descends, it is called “cow.”

original: skyes bu'i dus su ste khu ba bgrod pa'i dus su kun 'dar ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i dus su ste khu ba bgrod pa'i dus su kun 'dar ma zhes brjod do //
translated: At the time of the man, at the time of the passage of semen, it is called “vibration.”

original: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna bug dag la dkyil 'khor 'char bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna bug dag la dkyil 'khor 'char bar gsungs pa /
translated: The mandala of the right and left nostrils is said to rise.

original: rnam shes la sogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes la sogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The consciousnesses, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / sa la sogs pa sdud pa'i rim pas te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / sa la sogs pa sdud pa'i rim pas te /
translated: The five aggregates, beginning with consciousness, are produced in the order of the generation stage, and the earth, etc., are collected in the order of the dissolution stage.

original: sna bug g-yon pa la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas rnam par shes pa dang 'du byed dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga 'bab po //
analyzed: sna bug g-yon pa la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas rnam par shes pa dang 'du byed dang / tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i phung po lnga 'bab po //
translated: The five aggregates called consciousness, formation, sensation, perception, and form flow through the left nostril in the order to be explained.

original: de bzhin du g-yas pa la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i khams lnga 'bab po //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas pa la sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i khams lnga 'bab po //
translated: Similarly, the five elements called earth, water, fire, wind, and space flow through the right nostril.

original: dbus su ste dbu ma'i lam du drug pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga las dkyil 'khor so so'i dbugs rkang pa dang bcas pa'i bcu gcig bzung nas dbugs rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu tsa drug gi bdag nyid 'bab po //
analyzed: dbus su ste dbu ma'i lam du drug pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga las dkyil 'khor so so'i dbugs rkang pa dang bcas pa'i bcu gcig bzung nas dbugs rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu tsa drug gi bdag nyid 'bab po //
translated: In the middle, i.e., in the central channel, the five mandalas of the sixth consciousness, etc., are held in each of the mandalas, and the five mandalas flow in the form of fifty-six breaths with their accompanying legs.

original: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dbu ma'i rtsa 'di rnam la nyin mtshan gyi dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab po //
analyzed: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dbu ma'i rtsa 'di rnam la nyin mtshan gyi dkyil 'khor drug cu 'bab po //
translated: In these three channels of the left, right, and middle, the sixty mandalas of day and night flow.

original: de la lte ba'i padma'i 'dab ma'i g-yon gyi 'dab ma drug lug dang 'khrig pa dang seng ge dang srang dang gzhu dang / bum pa'i bdag nyid rnams la so sor rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dkyil @266a * //🔽'khor lnga'i bdag nyid las dkyil 'khor sum cu rnams so //
analyzed: de la lte ba'i padma'i 'dab ma'i g-yon gyi 'dab ma drug lug dang 'khrig pa dang seng ge dang srang dang gzhu dang / bum pa'i bdag nyid rnams la so sor rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dkyil @266a * // 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid las dkyil 'khor sum cu rnams so //
translated: Therein, on the six left petals of the navel lotus, the six mandalas of the five elements beginning with consciousness flow in the six petals of Aries, Taurus, Leo, Libra, Sagittarius, and Aquarius.

original: de bzhin du g-yas kyi 'dab ma drug glang dang karka ta dang bu mo dang sdig pa dang chu srin dang nya'i bdag nyid rnams la so sor sa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid las dkyil 'khor sum cu rnams so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas kyi 'dab ma drug glang dang karka ta dang bu mo dang sdig pa dang chu srin dang nya'i bdag nyid rnams la so sor sa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid las dkyil 'khor sum cu rnams so ;
translated: On the six right petals, the six mandalas of the five elements beginning with earth flow in the six petals of Taurus, Cancer, Virgo, Scorpio, Capricorn, and Pisces.

original: / de la gang gi tshe g-yas su glang la sogs pa'i dus sbyor la rlung 'bab pa de'i tshe rtsa ba ste sna bug gi 'og gi cha la sa'i dkyil 'khor dbyu gu gcig 'bab po //
analyzed: / de la gang gi tshe g-yas su glang la sogs pa'i dus sbyor la rlung 'bab pa de'i tshe rtsa ba ste sna bug gi 'og gi cha la sa'i dkyil 'khor dbyu gu gcig 'bab po //
translated: When the wind moves through the right nostril, in the zodiacs of Taurus and so on, then the earth mandala moves in the lower part, that is, below the nostril.

original: de bzhin du de nyid kyi cha sna rgyud kyi phyogs su chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid kyi cha sna rgyud kyi phyogs su chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the same way, in the same place, in the direction of the nose, the water mandala.

original: g-yas te g-yas kyi tshal me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: g-yas te g-yas kyi tshal me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the right, that is, in the right nostril, the fire mandala.

original: steng gi cha la rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: steng gi cha la rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the upper part, the wind mandala.

original: dbus su stong pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dbus su stong pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the middle, the space mandala.

original: de ltar sna bug gnyis ka la dkyil 'khor re re zhing dbyu gu nas dbyu gu'i bar du 'bab ste dbyu gu lnga rnams kyi dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar sna bug gnyis ka la dkyil 'khor re re zhing dbyu gu nas dbyu gu'i bar du 'bab ste dbyu gu lnga rnams kyi dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, in each nostril, the mandalas move from one ghatika to the next, for a total of five ghatikas.

original: g-yon pa'i sna bug gi ni 'dab ma'i dbus dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur te de la ltos nas sna bug dga' la'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i sna bug gi ni 'dab ma'i dbus dang zhes pa la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur te de la ltos nas sna bug dga' la'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mandalas move in the left nostril, in the middle of the petals, and so on.

original: chu tshod gcig la dbugs du 'bab ce na /
analyzed: chu tshod gcig la dbugs du 'bab ce na /
translated: How many breaths move in one ghatika?

original: gsungs pa / rim pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rim pas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: rim pas ni sa la sogs pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rim pas ni sa la sogs pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pas so //
translated: By the sequence of earth, etc., and space, etc.

original: de la chu tshod gcig la 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dag gcig tu byas pa'i dbugs drug cu dang bcas pa'i sum brgya 'bab po //
analyzed: de la chu tshod gcig la 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dag gcig tu byas pa'i dbugs drug cu dang bcas pa'i sum brgya 'bab po //
translated: There, in one period, three hundred breaths flow, with sixty breaths together with the entry and emergence.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor lnga dus sbyor zhes bya bas bsgyur na dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor lnga dus sbyor zhes bya bas bsgyur na dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by the so-called conjunctions of the five maṇḍalas, there are eighteen hundred breaths.

original: de rnams kyang sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga'i rang bzhin chu tshod lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga'i rang bzhin chu tshod lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: And those, by the nature of the five maṇḍalas of earth, etc., are five periods.

original: de ltar dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad po rnams kyang 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyis bsgyur bas nyin mtshan gyis dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad po rnams kyang 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyis bsgyur bas nyin mtshan gyis dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the eighteen hundred breaths, by the transformation of the twelve transits, are twenty-one thousand and six hundred breaths in a day and night.

original: de rnams kyang lus la chu tshod drug cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang lus la chu tshod drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: And those are sixty periods in the body.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: chu tshod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu tshod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the periods, etc.

original: rtsa g-yon par dus sbyor 'char ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsa g-yon par dus sbyor 'char ba gsungs pa /
translated: The rising of the lunar mansions in the left channel is stated.

original: 'dab ma'i dbus dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma'i dbus dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The center of the petals, etc.

original: gang gi g-yon pa'i rtsa la lug la sogs pas sna bug gi dbus su stong pa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab pa de'i tshe nang du lte ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'dab ma'i dbus su 'bab @266b po zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi g-yon pa'i rtsa la lug la sogs pas sna bug gi dbus su stong pa'i dkyil 'khor 'bab pa de'i tshe nang du lte ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'dab ma'i dbus su 'bab @266b po zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the lunar mansions, Aries, etc., fall in the center of the nostrils in the left channel, then it is explained that they fall in the center of the navel cakra on the inside.

original: de nas shar zhes pa steng du rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //🔽g-yas su me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de nas shar zhes pa steng du rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro // g-yas su me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Then, the east is the wind maṇḍala above.🔽The right is the fire maṇḍala.

original: g-yon du chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: g-yon du chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The left is the water maṇḍala.

original: gzhan du zhes pa 'og gi cha la sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes pa 'og gi cha la sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The other is the earth maṇḍala below.

original: rim pas zhes pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rim pas so ;
analyzed: rim pas zhes pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rim pas so ;
translated: The order is the order of space, etc.

original: / g-yon par zhes pa la sogs pas sngar brjod pa nyid gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: / g-yon par zhes pa la sogs pas sngar brjod pa nyid gsal bar byed de /
translated: The left, etc., clarifies what was previously stated.

original: phung po'i rten ni 'byung ba zhes pa'i gsung las brten pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung bo rnams dang lhan cig rten nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i khams rnams dbyer med par gsungs pa /
analyzed: phung po'i rten ni 'byung ba zhes pa'i gsung las brten pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung bo rnams dang lhan cig rten nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i khams rnams dbyer med par gsungs pa /
translated: The statement “the support of the aggregates is the elements” means that the aggregates of consciousness and so on are inseparable from the elements of space, wind, fire, water, and earth, which are their supports.

original: g-yon par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The left” and so on.🔽“From another” means from the beginning, as before.

original: gzhan las so zhes pa snga ma bzhin rtsa ba nas brtsams te zhes pa'i don te sna bug g-yon pa las gzhan las so //
analyzed: gzhan las so zhes pa snga ma bzhin rtsa ba nas brtsams te zhes pa'i don te sna bug g-yon pa las gzhan las so //
translated: “The left” means from the other nostril.

original: g-yon pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba zhes pa bskyed pa'i rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: g-yon pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba zhes pa bskyed pa'i rnam par gnas te /
translated: “The elements arise from consciousness and so on” means that the generation of the elements is present.

original: zla ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the moon.

original: g-yas par sa la sogs pa'i sdud pa ste /
analyzed: g-yas par sa la sogs pa'i sdud pa ste /
translated: “The right” means that earth and so on are gathered.

original: nyi ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the sun.

original: g-yon par zla ba gnas pa gang yin pa de shes rab dang bcas pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang g-yas par yang thabs dang bcas pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa
analyzed: g-yon par zla ba gnas pa gang yin pa de shes rab dang bcas pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang g-yas par yang thabs dang bcas pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa
translated: The moon on the left is the nature of Akṣobhya, etc., together with wisdom, the wheel of the mandala of consciousness, etc., and on the right is the nature of Locanā, etc., together with method, the wheel of the mandala of earth, etc.

original: la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste sngags dang lha'i bdag nyid spro ba dang sdud pa'i gzugs can lhan cig skyes pa sems can la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste sngags dang lha'i bdag nyid spro ba dang sdud pa'i gzugs can lhan cig skyes pa sems can la gnas pa'o //
translated: The innate nature of the mantra and deity, having the form of emanation and reabsorption, is present in sentient beings.

original: shes rab ces pa la sogs pas shes rab dang thabs nyid mdor bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa nub dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sna bug so sor nub dang ste nub tu sa'i rang bzhin spyan ma dang rnam par snad mdzad dag go //
analyzed: shes rab ces pa la sogs pas shes rab dang thabs nyid mdor bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa nub dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sna bug so sor nub dang ste nub tu sa'i rang bzhin spyan ma dang rnam par snad mdzad dag go //
translated: Wisdom and method are briefly taught by “wisdom” and so on. Their extensive explanation is “west” and so on. In the western nostril, the nature of earth is Locanā and Vairocana.

original: shar du rlung gi rang bzhin sgrol ma dang don yod grub pa dag go //
analyzed: shar du rlung gi rang bzhin sgrol ma dang don yod grub pa dag go //
translated: In the eastern nostril, the nature of wind is Tārā and Amoghasiddhi.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi shes rab sgrol ma dang don yod grub pa'i spyan ma'o zhes pa phan tshun zhal phyogs pas 'khyud pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi shes rab sgrol ma dang don yod grub pa'i spyan ma'o zhes pa phan tshun zhal phyogs pas 'khyud pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of Vairocana is Tara, and the eye of Amoghasiddhi is Lochana, and so on, with the certainty of embracing each other, facing each other.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i thabs dang bral zhing bsdus pa'i rgyud nyan pa ma rnyed pa rnams la yang dag pa'i rkyen gyis don gsal por shes par byed pa @267a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i thabs dang bral zhing bsdus pa'i rgyud nyan pa ma rnyed pa rnams la yang dag pa'i rkyen gyis don gsal por shes par byed pa @267a * //
translated: Therefore, for those who have not found the opportunity to listen to the tantra of the assembly, who are devoid of the method of the bodhisattva's activity, the clear meaning is made known by the perfect condition.

original: gsungs pa / mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: The thumb and the ring finger, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung la sogs pa'i sor mo lnga nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyi dbus su mthe bo dang ming med sa dang rlung gi rang bzhin dag 'khyud pa lha mnyes pa'i phyag rgya gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i don
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung la sogs pa'i sor mo lnga nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyi dbus su mthe bo dang ming med sa dang rlung gi rang bzhin dag 'khyud pa lha mnyes pa'i phyag rgya gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i don
translated: Because the five fingers of the left hand, which have the nature of space, and so on, embrace the thumb and the little finger, which have the nature of earth and wind, in the center, the secret empowerment is given for the purpose of pleasing the deity.

original: du slob ma'i kha dang lha mnyes pa la ston pa de'i phyir sa dang rlung dag phan tshun gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por shes rab dang thabs nyid grub po //
analyzed: du slob ma'i kha dang lha mnyes pa la ston pa de'i phyir sa dang rlung dag phan tshun gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por shes rab dang thabs nyid grub po //
translated: The mouth of the disciple and the deity are shown to be pleased by the mutual embrace of earth and wind. Therefore, wisdom and method are established as the mutual embrace of earth and wind.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pas bya ba 'grub kyi rang gi rigs la 'khyud pas ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pas bya ba 'grub kyi rang gi rigs la 'khyud pas ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of action is by embracing another type, not by embracing one's own type,

original: rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because action on one's own self is contradictory.

original: sa'i khams las byung ba'i lus kyi dbang po rlung gi khams las byung ba'i yul reg bya 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: sa'i khams las byung ba'i lus kyi dbang po rlung gi khams las byung ba'i yul reg bya 'dzin par byed de /
translated: The body faculty, which arises from the earth element, apprehends the object of touch, which arises from the wind element.

original: de nas bshang ba dang gci ba'i rtsa dag shes rab dang thabs su brjod do //
analyzed: de nas bshang ba dang gci ba'i rtsa dag shes rab dang thabs su brjod do //
translated: Then, the channels of feces and urine are called wisdom and method.

original: g-yas su me'i rang bzhin gos dkar mo dang rin chen 'byung ldan dag go //
analyzed: g-yas su me'i rang bzhin gos dkar mo dang rin chen 'byung ldan dag go //
translated: On the right, yellow Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Ratnasaṃbhava have the nature of fire.

original: g-yon du chu'i rang bzhin m'a ma k'i dang 'od dpag med dag go //
analyzed: g-yon du chu'i rang bzhin m'a ma k'i dang 'od dpag med dag go //
translated: On the left, blue Māmakī and Amitābha have the nature of water.

original: de'i phyir 'od dpag med kyi shes rab gos dkar mo dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyi m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od dpag med kyi shes rab gos dkar mo dang rin chen 'byung ldan gyi m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of Amitābha is Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and the mother of Ratnasaṃbhava is Māmakī.

original: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas ba'i gung mo mdzub mo me dang chu'i rang bzhin dag 'khyud par ral gri'i phyag rgya ston cing me'i khams las skyes pa'i yul ro chu'i khams las byung ba'i ro 'dzin dbang po 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir me dang chu dag
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas ba'i gung mo mdzub mo me dang chu'i rang bzhin dag 'khyud par ral gri'i phyag rgya ston cing me'i khams las skyes pa'i yul ro chu'i khams las byung ba'i ro 'dzin dbang po 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir me dang chu dag
translated: Since the middle finger and the index finger of the right hand, which are of the nature of fire and water, respectively, embrace, displaying the sword mudrā, the fire element born from the tongue faculty of the water element born from the object is grasped. Therefore, fire and water

original: shes rab dang thabs nyid du grub po //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs nyid du grub po //
translated: are established as wisdom and method.

original: des na la n'a dang ra sa n'a dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: des na la n'a dang ra sa n'a dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: Therefore, lalanā and rasanā are wisdom and method.

original: dbu mar steng gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa stong pa'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa 'og gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: dbu mar steng gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa stong pa'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa 'og gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Above the central nāḍī, the empty nature of Akṣobhya is located above, and the unchanging wisdom nature of Prajñāpāramitā is located below, embracing.

original: phan tshun zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i steng 'og tu gnas pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' dag 'khyud pa yang snga ma la ltos nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i steng 'og tu gnas pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' dag 'khyud pa yang snga ma la ltos nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The each other should be understood in terms of the previous [verse], namely, the embrace of Vajradhātvīśvarī and Vajrasattva, who are located above and below.

original: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur la mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam par byas pa'i mi bskyod pa'i mche ba'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i gri gug gi phyag rgya yin pa de'i phyir @267b stong
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur la mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam par byas pa'i mi bskyod pa'i mche ba'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i gri gug gi phyag rgya yin pa de'i phyir @267b stong
translated: The mudrā of Akṣobhya's fang, which is the right fist with the little finger in the shape of a half-moon, is the mudrā of the flaying knife of Prajñāpāramitā. Therefore, it is said: The flaying knife is the fang.

original: pa dang ye shes dang shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: pa dang ye shes dang shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: Wisdom, gnosis, prajñā, and upāya are the same.

original: de nas aa wa dh'u t'i dang dung can ma dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: de nas aa wa dh'u t'i dang dung can ma dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: Then, the avadhūti and the śaṅkhinī are wisdom and upāya.

original: de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad par rigs drug pa 'khyud pa'i shes rab byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshigs su bcad par rigs drug pa 'khyud pa'i shes rab byed pa gsungs te /
translated: Immediately after that, in the verse to be explained, the wisdom that embraces the six families is stated.

original: gang gi phyir g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i lag mthil yang dag par sbyar ba spyi bor byas pa na stong pa la sogs pa'o rang bzhin sor mi rnams phan tshun sbyor ba dkyil 'khor bcu sbyor ba byas pa gang gi tshe rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje rtse
analyzed: gang gi phyir g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i lag mthil yang dag par sbyar ba spyi bor byas pa na stong pa la sogs pa'o rang bzhin sor mi rnams phan tshun sbyor ba dkyil 'khor bcu sbyor ba byas pa gang gi tshe rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje rtse
translated: Because when the palms of the left and right hands are joined together and placed on the crown of the head, the fingers are mutually joined in the ten circles, and the nature of emptiness, etc.

original: gcig pa'i phyag rgya yin la /
analyzed: gcig pa'i phyag rgya yin la /
translated: is made into the mudra of the single-pronged vajra of Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i chu gri'i rnam pa gri gug gi phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i chu gri'i rnam pa gri gug gi phyag rgya yin te /
translated: That itself is the mudra of the curved knife, the form of the water-born lotus of Vajradhatviśvari.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: Therefore, these are wisdom and means.

original: 'dis 'di yang nye bar mtshon par byed de dbu ma 'bab pa'i sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems zhu ba 'pho ba med ba'i bde bas rdo rje'i rtse mo las steng du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'di yang nye bar mtshon par byed de dbu ma 'bab pa'i sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems zhu ba 'pho ba med ba'i bde bas rdo rje'i rtse mo las steng du bya'o //
translated: This also illustrates that by the yoga of the descent of the central channel, the melting bodhicitta is the bliss of non-emission, which should be brought upward from the tip of the vajra.

original: de nyid gri gug ste mi shes pa gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid gri gug ste mi shes pa gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the curved knife, because it has the nature of cutting ignorance.

original: phyi rol du rigs drug pa gri gug dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang nang du mnyam pa ste nyi ma dang zla ba mnyam par 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du rigs drug pa gri gug dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang nang du mnyam pa ste nyi ma dang zla ba mnyam par 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Externally, the one who is the nature of a single-pronged vajra with a curved knife and the six clans is also internally equal, because the sun and moon descend equally.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i la 'bab pa'i mnyam pa yang skye ba'i dus su 'bab pa las skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i la 'bab pa'i mnyam pa yang skye ba'i dus su 'bab pa las skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The equality that descends into the central channel, the avadhūtī, is the cause of generation from the descent at the time of birth.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su 'bab pa las sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su 'bab pa las sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The descent at the time of death is the cause of dissolution.

original: yang de kho na sgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis phyi rol du 'bab pa 'gags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid las skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang de kho na sgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis phyi rol du 'bab pa 'gags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid las skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Moreover, for yogis who meditate on reality, the external descent is stopped, and it is the cause of generation from the cause of the transcendent aggregates and so on.

original: 'khor ba pa rnams kyis ma 'gags pa phung po la sogs pa nyams par byed pa nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa rnams kyis ma 'gags pa phung po la sogs pa nyams par byed pa nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: For those in cyclic existence, the undiminished descent is the cause of dissolution by the degeneration of the aggregates and so on.

original: de yang mnyam pa sngar brjod pa'i sna bug g-yon par 'bab pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / sna bug g-yas par 'bab pa'i khams lnga rnams dang / lte ba dang gsang ba dang nor bu'i padmar gnas pa sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams kyi yang gcig nyid kho na dbu ma'i rtsar son pa ni yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang mnyam pa sngar brjod pa'i sna bug g-yon par 'bab pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / sna bug g-yas par 'bab pa'i khams lnga rnams dang / lte ba dang gsang ba dang nor bu'i padmar gnas pa sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams kyi yang gcig nyid kho na dbu ma'i rtsar son pa ni yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the five aggregates that flow in the left nostril, the five elements that flow in the right nostril, and the body, speech, and mind vajras that abide in the navel, secret, and jewel lotuses are all one, and they enter the central channel.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pa rlung 'bab pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i zol gyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha thams cad dang ye shes kyi rnam par gzhag pa brjod pa'o //🔽zla ba nyi ma'i zhes pa la sogs pa la gang gi tshe steng du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra @268a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pa rlung 'bab pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i zol gyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha thams cad dang ye shes kyi rnam par gzhag pa brjod pa'o // zla ba nyi ma'i zhes pa la sogs pa la gang gi tshe steng du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra @268a * //
translated: This is the statement of the arrangement of the deities of the maṇḍalacakra and the arrangement of the gnoses by way of the arrangement of the flow of the vāyu.

original: gcan gyi rtsa rnams 'gags pa de'i tshe 'og tu bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba'i rtsa rnams 'gag go //
analyzed: gcan gyi rtsa rnams 'gags pa de'i tshe 'og tu bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba'i rtsa rnams 'gag go //
translated: When the channels of the moon, sun, and Rāhu above are blocked, then below the channels of feces, urine, and semen are blocked.

original: de bzhin du steng du gsum po rnams grol nas 'og tu gsum po rnams grol lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du steng du gsum po rnams grol nas 'og tu gsum po rnams grol lo //
translated: In the same way, after the three above are freed, the three below are freed.

original: rtsa drug po de rnams kyang snga ma bzhin skyed pa dang sdud pa'i byed pa can no //
analyzed: rtsa drug po de rnams kyang snga ma bzhin skyed pa dang sdud pa'i byed pa can no //
translated: And those six channels are the agents of generation and dissolution, as before.

original: 'chi ltas kyi mchan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'chi ltas kyi mchan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The characteristics of the signs of death are stated:

original: g-yon pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: On the left, etc.

original: lug la po gas pa mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes ba che thung ba rnams kyi lus la rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan mi mnyam ste /
analyzed: lug la po gas pa mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes ba che thung ba rnams kyi lus la rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan mi mnyam ste /
translated: For those born in the unequal asterisms Aries, Taurus, and Gemini, wind, bile, and phlegm are unequal in the body.

original: mi mnyam pas srog ces bya ba'i rlung dbyu gu lnga 'bab pa'i rim pa las 'das nas g-yon pa'i rtsar lhag pa 'bab po //
analyzed: mi mnyam pas srog ces bya ba'i rlung dbyu gu lnga 'bab pa'i rim pa las 'das nas g-yon pa'i rtsar lhag pa 'bab po //
translated: Because of the inequality, the wind called life, which normally flows in five-finger periods, exceeds the normal flow in the left channel.

original: ci ltar lhag ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar lhag ce na /
translated: How does it exceed?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / mtshan mo gcig ces pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / mtshan mo gcig ces pa ste /
translated: In one night.

original: gang gi tshe mtshan mo gcig nyin mtshan du 'bab pa de'i 'chi ltas rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mtshan mo gcig nyin mtshan du 'bab pa de'i 'chi ltas rtsom pa ste /
translated: When it flows in one night as much as in a day and night, then the signs of death begin.

original: 'chi ltas de las lo gsum gyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ltas de las lo gsum gyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
translated: From those signs of death, one should know that death will occur in three years.

original: de bzhin du glang la sogs pa mnyam pa'i dus sbyor las skyes pa rnams kyi g-yas pa'i rtsang nyin mtshan lnga 'bab pa las lo gsum gyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o zhes pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du glang la sogs pa mnyam pa'i dus sbyor las skyes pa rnams kyi g-yas pa'i rtsang nyin mtshan lnga 'bab pa las lo gsum gyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o zhes pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one should know that those born in the equal periods of the bull, etc., have a life of three years, from the flow of the life-breath in the right nostril for five days and nights.

original: re zhig nyi ma'i 'chi ltas rgyas bar bshad pa /
analyzed: re zhig nyi ma'i 'chi ltas rgyas bar bshad pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of the sun's omens of death.

original: g-yas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The right, etc.

original: lte ba'i padma'i snying por yongs su bskor ba la khyim gyi bdag nyid 'dab ma bcu gnyis kyi sngon gyi 'dab ma la nyin mtshan lngar srog 'bab po //
analyzed: lte ba'i padma'i snying por yongs su bskor ba la khyim gyi bdag nyid 'dab ma bcu gnyis kyi sngon gyi 'dab ma la nyin mtshan lngar srog 'bab po //
translated: The life-breath flows for five days and nights on the petal of the previous house in the center of the navel lotus, which is completely surrounded by twelve petals.

original: de nas g-yas skor gyi 'dab ma gnyis ba'i phyogs zhes pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de nas g-yas skor gyi 'dab ma gnyis ba'i phyogs zhes pa bcu'o //
translated: Then, in the second petal of the clockwise direction, there are ten.

original: gsum pa la tshes zhes pa bco lnga'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la tshes zhes pa bco lnga'o //
translated: In the third, there are fifteen called lunar days.

original: bzhi pa la nyi shu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la nyi shu'o //
translated: In the fourth, there are twenty.

original: lnga pa la de nyid ces pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la de nyid ces pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: In the fifth, there are twenty-five called that itself.

original: drug pa la gcig lhag rim pas te nyi shu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: drug pa la gcig lhag rim pas te nyi shu rtsa drug go //
translated: In the sixth, there are twenty-six, one more in sequence.

original: bdun pa la slar yang gcig lhag rim pas nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun du srog 'bab po //
analyzed: bdun pa la slar yang gcig lhag rim pas nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun du srog 'bab po //
translated: In the seventh, again, by the order of one more, for twenty-seven days the life-force descends.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir nyi mas zla ba'i yon tan sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri rnams bzung nas 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag rnams bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir nyi mas zla ba'i yon tan sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri rnams bzung nas 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag rnams bstan te /
translated: Because here the sun, having taken the qualities of the moon, sound, touch, taste, form, and smell, shows the days of the signs of death.

original: des na khyim lnga'i bar du lnga pa lngas 'phel lo //
analyzed: des na khyim lnga'i bar du lnga pa lngas 'phel lo //
translated: Therefore, up to the fifth house, it increases by five fives.

original: de nas khyim drug pa dang bdun pa la gcig lhag pas rim pas 'phel lo //
analyzed: de nas khyim drug pa dang bdun pa la gcig lhag pas rim pas 'phel lo //
translated: Then, in the sixth and seventh houses, it increases by one more, respectively.

original: khyim bdun pa la rdzogs pa'i dus te khu ba'i khams la 'chi ltas kyi rlung rab tu zhugs pa'i @268b phyir gang du 'ga' zhig gis kyang srog ldog par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: khyim bdun pa la rdzogs pa'i dus te khu ba'i khams la 'chi ltas kyi rlung rab tu zhugs pa'i @268b phyir gang du 'ga' zhig gis kyang srog ldog par byed mi nus so //
translated: In the seventh house, the time of completion, because the wind of the signs of death enters the semen element, no one is able to reverse the life-force there.

original: rdzogs pa'i dus de nas khu ba'i khams zad pa'i don du brgyan pa la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la rim pas nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rgyu'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dus de nas khu ba'i khams zad pa'i don du brgyan pa la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la rim pas nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rgyu'o //
translated: From that time of completion, for the purpose of exhausting the semen element, the thirty-three days flow through the petals of the cakras, such as the one in the head, in order.

original: de la brgyad pa la bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de la brgyad pa la bco lnga'o //
translated: In the eighth, fifteen.

original: dgu pa la bcu'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la bcu'o //
translated: On the ninth, ten.

original: bcu pa la lnga'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la lnga'o //
translated: On the tenth, five.

original: bcu gcig pa la gsum mo zhes pa nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rnams so //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la gsum mo zhes pa nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rnams so //
translated: On the eleventh, three.

original: bcu gnyis pa la ni stong pa ste slar yang g-yas pa'i rtsa la 'bab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la ni stong pa ste slar yang g-yas pa'i rtsa la 'bab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the twelfth, zero, because the life-wind does not flow again in the right channel.

original: de nas g-yas pa'i rtsa dor nas g-yon par nyin zhag gnyis srog gi rlung 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas g-yas pa'i rtsa dor nas g-yon par nyin zhag gnyis srog gi rlung 'gro'o //
translated: Then, having passed over the right channel, the life-wind flows for two days in the left channel.

original: de nas nyin zhag gcig dbu mar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag gcig dbu mar 'gro'o //
translated: Then, for one day, it flows in the central channel.

original: kye'i rdo rje 'bum phrag lnga par yang gsungs pa /🔽gang tshe g-yas pa'i rtsa dag la //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje 'bum phrag lnga par yang gsungs pa / gang tshe g-yas pa'i rtsa dag la //
translated: The Hevajra Tantra in Five Hundred Thousand Lines also says:

original: rlung ni nyin zhag bcur 'bab na //
analyzed: rlung ni nyin zhag bcur 'bab na //
translated: When the wind flows for ten days🔽in the right channel,

original: khyim gyi 'dab ma gnyis pa la //
analyzed: khyim gyi 'dab ma gnyis pa la //
translated: in the second petal of the house,

original: de la lo gnyis kyis 'chi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la lo gnyis kyis 'chi 'gyur //
translated: death will come in two years.

original: khyim gyi 'dab ma gsum pa la //
analyzed: khyim gyi 'dab ma gsum pa la //
translated: In the third petal of the house,

original: tshes zhes brjod pas lo gcig la //
analyzed: tshes zhes brjod pas lo gcig la //
translated: it is said to be a month.

original: nyin zhag nyi shu 'bab gyur na //
analyzed: nyin zhag nyi shu 'bab gyur na //
translated: If it flows for twenty days,

original: bzhi pa la ste zla drug na //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ste zla drug na //
translated: in the fourth, after six months,

original: 'dab ma lnga par nye shu lnga //
analyzed: 'dab ma lnga par nye shu lnga //
translated: in the fifth petal,

original: 'bab na tshe ni zla ba gsum //
analyzed: 'bab na tshe ni zla ba gsum //
translated: if it flows for twenty-five days, life ends in three months.

original: nyin zhag nyi shu drug 'bab na //
analyzed: nyin zhag nyi shu drug 'bab na //
translated: If it falls for twenty-six days,

original: drug pa la ste zla gnyis tshe //
analyzed: drug pa la ste zla gnyis tshe //
translated: in the sixth, after two months.

original: nyin zhag nyi shu bdun 'bab na //
analyzed: nyin zhag nyi shu bdun 'bab na //
translated: If it falls for twenty-seven days,

original: zla ba nyid tshe bdun pa la //
analyzed: zla ba nyid tshe bdun pa la //
translated: in the seventh, after two months.

original: nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rnams //
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rnams //
translated: If it falls for thirty-three days,

original: 'di las bar ma chad 'bab na //
analyzed: 'di las bar ma chad 'bab na //
translated: without interruption,🔽in the eighth petal, the ninth, the tenth, and the eleventh,

original: 'dab ma brgyad par dgu pa dang // bcu dang bcu gcig rim pa yis //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad par dgu pa dang // bcu dang bcu gcig rim pa yis //
translated: in order,

original: nyin zhag tshes phyogs lnga yon tan //
analyzed: nyin zhag tshes phyogs lnga yon tan //
translated: the five qualities of the lunar days

original: rnams kyis 'dab ma de rnams 'dor //
analyzed: rnams kyis 'dab ma de rnams 'dor //
translated: are lost in those petals.

original: de nas g-yas pa'i rtsa spangs nas //
analyzed: de nas g-yas pa'i rtsa spangs nas //
translated: Then, having abandoned the right channel,

original: rlung ni g-yon par nyin zhag gnyis //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yon par nyin zhag gnyis //
translated: the wind goes for two days in the left.

original: 'gro'o de nas dbu ma yis //
analyzed: 'gro'o de nas dbu ma yis //
translated: Then, by the central channel,

original: gnas su nyin zhag gcig 'gro'o //
analyzed: gnas su nyin zhag gcig 'gro'o //
translated: it goes for one day to the place.

original: de nas dbugs ni zad byas nas //
analyzed: de nas dbugs ni zad byas nas //
translated: Then, having exhausted the breath,

original: 'chi ba'i phyir na rim pa 'dis //🔽'og tu khu ba zad par 'gro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i phyir na rim pa 'dis // 'og tu khu ba zad par 'gro //
translated: in this order, for the sake of death,🔽it goes below, to the exhaustion of semen,

original: steng du ma yi rdul 'gro 'gyur //🔽rang las bag chags kyis bcings pa'i //
analyzed: steng du ma yi rdul 'gro 'gyur // rang las bag chags kyis bcings pa'i //
translated: and above, to the exhaustion of blood.🔽Consciousness, bound by traces and instincts from itself,

original: rnam shes sreg dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: rnam shes sreg dang yang dag ldan //
translated: is endowed with burning.

original: shi nas slar yang srid par 'gro //
analyzed: shi nas slar yang srid par 'gro //
translated: Having died, it goes again to existence.

original: des na pha rol med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na pha rol med mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the other side is not nonexistent.

original: dper na mkhan po las rig pa //
analyzed: dper na mkhan po las rig pa //
translated: For example, from a master, knowledge;

original: mar me las ni mar me dang // bzhin las me long la bzhin dang // rgya las rgya gzhan ji lta bar //
analyzed: mar me las ni mar me dang // bzhin las me long la bzhin dang // rgya las rgya gzhan ji lta bar //
translated: from a lamp, a lamp; from a face, a reflection in a mirror; from a seal, another seal.

original: zhes ma 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag rgyu ba'i rim pa'o //🔽da ni 'chi ltas kyi @269a * //
analyzed: zhes ma 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag rgyu ba'i rim pa'o // da ni 'chi ltas kyi @269a * //
translated: This is the order of the movement of the signs of death on the days.🔽Now, the three periods of life of the signs of death

original: bdag nyid 'tsho ba'i dus kyi rim pa gsum gsungs pa /🔽de rtogs pa'i don du zlum po rim pa gnyis pa bris la gsum gcig lo zhes pa lo rnams ni sngon gyi 'dab ma la gsum mo //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'tsho ba'i dus kyi rim pa gsum gsungs pa / de rtogs pa'i don du zlum po rim pa gnyis pa bris la gsum gcig lo zhes pa lo rnams ni sngon gyi 'dab ma la gsum mo //
translated: are stated.🔽For the purpose of understanding that, draw a circle in two stages.

original: 'dab ma gnyis pa la gnyis so //🔽gsum pa la gcig go ;
analyzed: 'dab ma gnyis pa la gnyis so // gsum pa la gcig go ;
translated: The leaves are three, two, and one. The leaves are three on the previous leaf, two on the second leaf, and one on the third leaf.🔽The months are six, three, and one.

original: / zla ba rnams kyang 'dab ma bzhi pa la drug go //
analyzed: / zla ba rnams kyang 'dab ma bzhi pa la drug go //
translated: The months are six on the fourth leaf, three on the fifth leaf, and one on the sixth leaf.

original: lnga pa la gsum mo //🔽drug pa la gnyis so //🔽bdun pa la gcig go //🔽nyin zhag rnams ni 'dab ma brgyad pa la bco lnga'o //🔽dgu pa la bcu'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la gsum mo // drug pa la gnyis so // bdun pa la gcig go // nyin zhag rnams ni 'dab ma brgyad pa la bco lnga'o // dgu pa la bcu'o //
translated: The days are fifteen, ten, and five.

original: bcu pa la lnga'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la lnga'o //
translated: The days are fifteen on the eighth leaf, ten on the ninth leaf, and five on the tenth leaf.

original: bcu gcig pa la gsum mo //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la gsum mo //
translated: The half-months are three and one.🔽The half-months are three on the eleventh leaf, and one on the twelfth leaf.

original: bcu gnyis pa la gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la gnyis so //
translated: On the twelfth, two.

original: padma'i lte ba la gcig go //
analyzed: padma'i lte ba la gcig go //
translated: On the pericarp, one.

original: 'dis 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis 'di gsungs te /
translated: This is what he says.

original: dang po sngon gyi 'dab ma la nyin zhag lnga 'bab po //
analyzed: dang po sngon gyi 'dab ma la nyin zhag lnga 'bab po //
translated: First, five days fall on the previous petal.

original: de nas tshe lo brgya pa rnams kyi bzhin du 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyis 'tsho bar bya ba'i lo gsum gyi nyin zhag gi tshogs brgyad du lhag pa'i stong gi bdag nyid las sum cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i sum brgya 'bab po //
analyzed: de nas tshe lo brgya pa rnams kyi bzhin du 'pho ba bcu gnyis kyis 'tsho bar bya ba'i lo gsum gyi nyin zhag gi tshogs brgyad du lhag pa'i stong gi bdag nyid las sum cu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i sum brgya 'bab po //
translated: Then, for those whose life span is one hundred years, the life force flows for three years, which is the sum of one thousand days plus eighty days divided into twelve transits, as if it were a month.

original: de slar yang gzhan la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir 'dab ma de skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de slar yang gzhan la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir 'dab ma de skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, because it enters another, that petal dries up.

original: de nas 'dab ma de stong par byas te lhag ma'i nyin zhag gi tshogs lhag ma bzung nas srog gi nus pa 'dab ma gnyis pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag bcu 'bab po //
analyzed: de nas 'dab ma de stong par byas te lhag ma'i nyin zhag gi tshogs lhag ma bzung nas srog gi nus pa 'dab ma gnyis pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag bcu 'bab po //
translated: Then, having made that petal empty, having taken up the remaining days, the life force enters the second petal, where it flows for ten days.

original: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang / lhan cig 'pho ba bcu gcig gis nyin zhag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i sum brgya 'bab po //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang / lhan cig 'pho ba bcu gcig gis nyin zhag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i sum brgya 'bab po //
translated: In this, the days of movement and the eleven transits make 45 days out of 300.

original: de nas gnyis pa stong par byas te nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas gsum pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa stong par byas te nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas gsum pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: Then, having made the second empty and taken the remaining days, one enters the third.

original: de la nyin zhag pa co lnga 'bab po //
analyzed: de la nyin zhag pa co lnga 'bab po //
translated: In this, 15 days fall.

original: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba bcus nyin zhag bdun cu lhag pa'i brgya 'bab ste 'dab ma de skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba bcus nyin zhag bdun cu lhag pa'i brgya 'bab ste 'dab ma de skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this, the days of movement and the ten transits make 100 days out of 70. That petal dries up.

original: gsum pa stong par byas te nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas bzhi pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag nyi shu 'bab po //
analyzed: gsum pa stong par byas te nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas bzhi pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag nyi shu 'bab po //
translated: Having made the third empty and taken the remaining days, one enters the fourth. In this, 20 days fall.

original: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba dgus nyin zhag brgyad cu rtsa gnyis 'bab ste bzhi pa skam bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba dgus nyin zhag brgyad cu rtsa gnyis 'bab ste bzhi pa skam bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this, the days of movement and the nine transits make 82 days out of 70. The fourth dries up.

original: 'dab ma de stong par byas te nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas lnga pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga 'bab po //
analyzed: 'dab ma de stong par byas te nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas lnga pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga 'bab po //
translated: Having emptied that petal, he enters the fifth petal, which lasts twenty-five days.

original: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang @269b lhan cig 'pho ba brgyad kyis nyin zhag lnga bcu rtsa bdun 'bab ste 'dab ma de skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang @269b lhan cig 'pho ba brgyad kyis nyin zhag lnga bcu rtsa bdun 'bab ste 'dab ma de skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, fifty-seven days elapse, including the moving days, by eight transits, and that petal dries up.

original: de nas nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas drug pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa drug 'bab po //
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag lhag ma bzung nas drug pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa drug 'bab po //
translated: Then, having emptied that petal, he enters the sixth petal, which lasts twenty-six days.

original: rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba bdun gyis nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa brgyad 'bab ste drug pa yang 'dor ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba bdun gyis nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa brgyad 'bab ste drug pa yang 'dor ro //
translated: There, twenty-eight days elapse, including the moving days, by seven transits, and the sixth petal is also discarded.

original: de nas drug pa stong par byas nas bdun pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyi shu rtsa bdun 'bab bo //
analyzed: de nas drug pa stong par byas nas bdun pa la rab tu 'jug ste de la nyi shu rtsa bdun 'bab bo //
translated: Then, having emptied the sixth petal, he enters the seventh petal, which lasts twenty-seven days.

original: rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba drug gis nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun 'bab ste bdun pa yang 'dor ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'pho ba drug gis nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun 'bab ste bdun pa yang 'dor ro //
translated: Together with the moving days, the six migrations cause twenty-seven days to elapse, and the seventh is also omitted.

original: bdun pa stong par byas te lhag ma nyin zhag gi tshogs sum cu rtsa drug bzung nas brgyad pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: bdun pa stong par byas te lhag ma nyin zhag gi tshogs sum cu rtsa drug bzung nas brgyad pa la 'jug go //
translated: Having made the seventh empty, the remaining thirty-six days are held, and the eighth is entered.

original: 'pho ba lngas nyin zhag bco lnga 'bab ste brgyad pa 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba lngas nyin zhag bco lnga 'bab ste brgyad pa 'dor ro //
translated: Five migrations cause fifteen days to elapse, and the eighth is omitted.

original: brgyad pa stong par byas nas lhag ma nyin zhag gi tshogs nyi shu rtsa gcig bzung ste dgu pa la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: brgyad pa stong par byas nas lhag ma nyin zhag gi tshogs nyi shu rtsa gcig bzung ste dgu pa la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Having made the eighth empty, the remaining twenty-one days are held, and the ninth is entered.

original: 'pho ba bzhis nyin zhag bcu 'bab ste dgu pa 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba bzhis nyin zhag bcu 'bab ste dgu pa 'dor ro //
translated: Four migrations cause ten days to elapse, and the ninth is omitted.

original: de ltar lhag ma nyin zhag bcu gcig bzung nas bcu pa la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar lhag ma nyin zhag bcu gcig bzung nas bcu pa la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Thus, having held the remaining eleven days, the tenth is entered.

original: 'pho ba gsum gyis nyin zhag lnga 'bab ste bcu pa 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba gsum gyis nyin zhag lnga 'bab ste bcu pa 'dor ro //
translated: Three migrations cause five days to elapse, and the tenth is omitted.

original: 'pho ba gnyis kyis nyin zhag gsum 'bab pas bcu gcig pa 'dor te /
analyzed: 'pho ba gnyis kyis nyin zhag gsum 'bab pas bcu gcig pa 'dor te /
translated: Two migrations cause three days to elapse, and the eleventh is omitted.

original: de ltar mkhris pa'i bdag nyid rngul gyi khams skams pa las 'dab ma bcu gcig skam mo //
analyzed: de ltar mkhris pa'i bdag nyid rngul gyi khams skams pa las 'dab ma bcu gcig skam mo //
translated: Thus, the sweat element, which is of the nature of bile, dries up from the eleven petals.

original: slar yang g-yas pa'i rtsa dor nas 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa la g-yon pa'i rtsar 'pho ba med pas nyin zhag gnyis 'bab ste bad kan gyi bdag nyid snying stobs kyi khams skams pa las pa las 'dab med skam par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: slar yang g-yas pa'i rtsa dor nas 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa la g-yon pa'i rtsar 'pho ba med pas nyin zhag gnyis 'bab ste bad kan gyi bdag nyid snying stobs kyi khams skams pa las pa las 'dab med skam par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Again, having passed over the right channel, the wind moves in the left channel for two days without moving to the twelfth petal, and the phlegm element, which is of the nature of sattva, dries up from the twelve petals.

original: / de nas padma'i lte ba dbu ma'i rtsar 'pho ba med pas nyin zhag gcig 'bab ste /
analyzed: / de nas padma'i lte ba dbu ma'i rtsar 'pho ba med pas nyin zhag gcig 'bab ste /
translated: Then, the wind moves in the central channel at the center of the lotus for one day without moving to the thirteenth petal.

original: rlung gi rang bzhin mun pa'i khams zad pa las de skams nas rnam par shes pa rjes su chags pa'i srog gi nus pa sna bug g-yas pa nas 'thon te dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyis 'phangs nas srid pa gzhan du 'pho bar
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin mun pa'i khams zad pa las de skams nas rnam par shes pa rjes su chags pa'i srog gi nus pa sna bug g-yas pa nas 'thon te dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyis 'phangs nas srid pa gzhan du 'pho bar
translated: The wind, which is of the nature of tamas, dries up, and consciousness, which is attached to life, exits through the right nostril and is projected to another existence by virtue of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: byed do // zla ba'i 'chi ltas gsungs pa /
analyzed: byed do // zla ba'i 'chi ltas gsungs pa /
translated: The signs of death of the moon are stated:

original: rtsa ba nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From the root, and so on.

original: rtsa ba nas zhes pa lte ba'i 'khor lo'i lug la sogs pa mi mnyam pa'i skye ba'i dus sbyor gyi bdag nyid sngon gyi 'dab ma nas brtsams te /🔽gcig @270a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba nas zhes pa lte ba'i 'khor lo'i lug la sogs pa mi mnyam pa'i skye ba'i dus sbyor gyi bdag nyid sngon gyi 'dab ma nas brtsams te / gcig @270a * //
translated: From the beginning means beginning from the petal of the past of the Aries and so on of the navel cakra, which is the nature of the birth junctures of the uneven [petals].

original: lhag pas zhes pa gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i rim pas nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du 'dab ma bcu gcig la g-yon gyi rtsa zla ba'i rgyu ba 'bab po //
analyzed: lhag pas zhes pa gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i rim pas nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du 'dab ma bcu gcig la g-yon gyi rtsa zla ba'i rgyu ba 'bab po //
translated: One more means that the flow of the left channel, the moon, descends on the eleven petals for thirty-three days in the order of one, two, three, and so on.

original: ji ltar gcig lhag pas shes nas gsungs ba /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig lhag pas shes nas gsungs ba /
translated: Having understood one more, it is said:

original: snying bo'i sngon gyi 'dab ma la nyin zhag gcig g-yon par 'bab po //
analyzed: snying bo'i sngon gyi 'dab ma la nyin zhag gcig g-yon par 'bab po //
translated: On the petal of the past of the heart, one day descends on the left.

original: nyin zhag des dman pa'i zla ba gnyis ji lta ba bzhin 'bab po //
analyzed: nyin zhag des dman pa'i zla ba gnyis ji lta ba bzhin 'bab po //
translated: Two months less than that day descend as it is.

original: de nas zla ba gsum pa'i dang por 'dab de nyid la nyin zhag gsum g-yon par 'bab po //
analyzed: de nas zla ba gsum pa'i dang por 'dab de nyid la nyin zhag gsum g-yon par 'bab po //
translated: Then, on the first of the third month, three days descend on that petal on the left.

original: nyin zhag des dman pa'i zla ba gsum pa dang bzhi pa la ji lta ba bzhin du 'bab po //
analyzed: nyin zhag des dman pa'i zla ba gsum pa dang bzhi pa la ji lta ba bzhin du 'bab po //
translated: Three and four months less than that day descend as it is.

original: zla ba lnga pa'i dang por 'dam ma de la nyin zhag gsum g-yon par 'bab po //
analyzed: zla ba lnga pa'i dang por 'dam ma de la nyin zhag gsum g-yon par 'bab po //
translated: In the first part of the fifth month, the semen flows for three days and nights in the swamp.

original: nyin zhag des dman pa'i zla ba lnga pa dang drug pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin 'bab po //
analyzed: nyin zhag des dman pa'i zla ba lnga pa dang drug pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin 'bab po //
translated: In the fifth and sixth months, which are less than that day, it flows as it should.

original: de ltar snga ma snga ma dang lhan cig tshogs pa'i zla ba dang po dang gsum pa dang lnga pa las gsum po 'di rnams nyid 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar snga ma snga ma dang lhan cig tshogs pa'i zla ba dang po dang gsum pa dang lnga pa las gsum po 'di rnams nyid 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, from the first, third, and fifth months, which are together with the previous, these three are established as the days of the signs of death.

original: yang na nyin mtshan rnam par ma chad par 'bab pa rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: yang na nyin mtshan rnam par ma chad par 'bab pa rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Or, it is established as flowing without interruption of day and night.

original: 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag gsum po 'dis lo gsum gyi nyin zhag gsum dang zla ba drug song ste 'dab ma de la srog gi rlung yang dag par rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag gsum po 'dis lo gsum gyi nyin zhag gsum dang zla ba drug song ste 'dab ma de la srog gi rlung yang dag par rgyu ba med do //
translated: By these three days of the signs of death, three days of three years have passed, and six months. In that swamp, the life-force wind does not flow correctly.

original: de ltar na 'pho ba bcu gcig rnams dang nyi khri brgyad gnyis brgya'i dbugs rnams kyis nyin mtshan byed de 'dab ma yongs su dor yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo dman pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'pho ba bcu gcig rnams dang nyi khri brgyad gnyis brgya'i dbugs rnams kyis nyin mtshan byed de 'dab ma yongs su dor yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo dman pa med do //
translated: Thus, the eleven transferences and the twenty-eight thousand and two hundred breaths make a day and night. Even though the petals are completely discarded, the wheel of breath does not decrease.

original: de bzhin du 'dab ma gnyis pa la zla ba bdun pa'i dang por 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dab ma gnyis pa la zla ba bdun pa'i dang por 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, on the second petal, the first of the seventh month is four days of death signs.

original: brgyad pa'i dang por lnga'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i dang por lnga'o //
translated: The first of the eighth month is five.

original: dgu pa'i dang por drug ste sngar nyin zhag gsum du rnam par bzhag pa sngon gyi 'dab ma'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag drug go //
analyzed: dgu pa'i dang por drug ste sngar nyin zhag gsum du rnam par bzhag pa sngon gyi 'dab ma'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag drug go //
translated: The first of the ninth month is six. The three days previously posited together with the days of the previous petal make six days of death signs.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa'i nyin zhag rnams la ji lta bzhin 'bab po //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa'i nyin zhag rnams la ji lta bzhin 'bab po //
translated: The second, third, and so on are as they occur.

original: 'dis kyang zla ba gsum song ste de ltar zla ba gsum gsum gyis nyin zhag gsum rnam par 'phal ba las 'dab ma bcu gcig po'i 'di rnams lo gsum la rim pas 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'dis kyang zla ba gsum song ste de ltar zla ba gsum gsum gyis nyin zhag gsum rnam par 'phal ba las 'dab ma bcu gcig po'i 'di rnams lo gsum la rim pas 'dor ro //
translated: This also passes three months. Thus, three months each increase by three days. These eleven petals are discarded in order over three years.

original: de ltar 'dab ma bcu gcig pa la 'bab pa las bab kan gyi bdag nyid snying stobs kyi khams rnams @270b skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dab ma bcu gcig pa la 'bab pa las bab kan gyi bdag nyid snying stobs kyi khams rnams @270b skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, from the descent onto the eleventh petal, the element of sattva, which has the nature of bile, dries up.

original: 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa la g-yas pa'i rtsar rab tu 'bab pa las 'dab ma gzhan la gnas pa zla ba gnyis pa dang bzhi pa drug pa'i mtshams kyi nyin zhag gsum gyis nyin zhag gnyis zad de mkhris pa'i bdag nyid rdul gyi khams zad pa las 'dab
analyzed: 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa la g-yas pa'i rtsar rab tu 'bab pa las 'dab ma gzhan la gnas pa zla ba gnyis pa dang bzhi pa drug pa'i mtshams kyi nyin zhag gsum gyis nyin zhag gnyis zad de mkhris pa'i bdag nyid rdul gyi khams zad pa las 'dab
translated: On the twelfth petal, from the descent into the right channel, the two days of the second, fourth, and sixth days of the other petal are exhausted. From the exhaustion of the element of rajas, which has the nature of bile,

original: ma bcu gnyis pa skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcu gnyis pa skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: the twelfth petal dries up.🔽At the navel, as before, from the descent of one day into the central channel, the element of tamas, which has the nature of wind, dries up, and one proceeds to another existence.

original: lte ba la snga ma bzhin du nyin zhag gcig dbu ma 'bab pa las rlung gi bdag nyid mun pa'i khams bskams nas srid pa gzhan du 'gro'o zhes pa g-yon pa'i 'chi ltas kyis rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa rnams 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: lte ba la snga ma bzhin du nyin zhag gcig dbu ma 'bab pa las rlung gi bdag nyid mun pa'i khams bskams nas srid pa gzhan du 'gro'o zhes pa g-yon pa'i 'chi ltas kyis rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa rnams 'chi ba'o //
translated: This is the death of non-yogis through the left signs of death.
