original: 'di rtogs pa'i don du bri ba'i rim pa ni khyim bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rim pa gnyis pa'i shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma bcu gcig la gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu gnyis dang bco lnga dang bcu brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa gcig dang nyi shu
analyzed: 'di rtogs pa'i don du bri ba'i rim pa ni khyim bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rim pa gnyis pa'i shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma bcu gcig la gsum dang drug dang dgu dang bcu gnyis dang bco lnga dang bcu brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa gcig dang nyi shu
translated: The process of writing for the purpose of understanding this is as follows: On the eleven petals of the east and so on of the second stage of the wheel of twelve houses, there are three, six, nine, twelve, fifteen, eighteen, twenty-one, twenty-four, twenty-seven, and thirty days.

original: rtsa bzhi dang nyi shu rtsa bdun dang sum cu rtsa gsum rnams te bcu gnyis pa la ni g-yon pa 'bab pa med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa bzhi dang nyi shu rtsa bdun dang sum cu rtsa gsum rnams te bcu gnyis pa la ni g-yon pa 'bab pa med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: On the twelfth house, there are none because the moon does not set.

original: phyi'i 'dab ma bcu gnyis la rim pas zla ba sum cu dang nyi shu rtsa bdun dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang bco brgyad dang bco lnga dang bcu gnyis dang dgu dang drug dang gsum rnams te bcu gcig pa la zla ba zad pa mtshon par byed pa
analyzed: phyi'i 'dab ma bcu gnyis la rim pas zla ba sum cu dang nyi shu rtsa bdun dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang bco brgyad dang bco lnga dang bcu gnyis dang dgu dang drug dang gsum rnams te bcu gcig pa la zla ba zad pa mtshon par byed pa
translated: On the twelve outer petals, there are thirty, twenty-seven, twenty-four, eighteen, fifteen, twelve, nine, six, and three days, respectively. On the eleventh, the moon is exhausted,

original: stong pa'o ; / bcu gnyis pa la nyin zhag gnyis so //
analyzed: stong pa'o ; / bcu gnyis pa la nyin zhag gnyis so //
translated: so it is empty. On the twelfth, there are two days.

original: lte ba la nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: lte ba la nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: At the center, there is one day.

original: de ltar na gsum pa la sogs pa nyin zhag rnams la 'chi ltas 'phel lo //
analyzed: de ltar na gsum pa la sogs pa nyin zhag rnams la 'chi ltas 'phel lo //
translated: Thus, the signs of death increase during the third and subsequent days.

original: sum cu la sogs pa'i zla ba rnams la dge ba 'grib pa ni 'tsho ba bzad pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu la sogs pa'i zla ba rnams la dge ba 'grib pa ni 'tsho ba bzad pa'o //
translated: The decrease of the good during the months of thirty days, etc. is the exhaustion of life.

original: phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba bcu dang ldan pa'i lo dgu bcu rtsa drug gi tshams su nyi ma dang zla ba 'bab pa'i dus so //
analyzed: phyed dang bcas pa'i zla ba bcu dang ldan pa'i lo dgu bcu rtsa drug gi tshams su nyi ma dang zla ba 'bab pa'i dus so //
translated: The period of the sun and moon is for ninety-six years, each consisting of ten months of thirty days.

original: lo brgya rdzogs pa'i nyin zhag sum gyis dman pa'i lo gsum dang phyogs gsum la dbu ma'i 'chi ba rgyu'o //
analyzed: lo brgya rdzogs pa'i nyin zhag sum gyis dman pa'i lo gsum dang phyogs gsum la dbu ma'i 'chi ba rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of death in the middle channel is for three years and three fortnights, less three days, at the end of a hundred years.🔽The detailed explanation of this is:

original: 'di rgyas par bshad pa mnyam dang mi nyam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rgyas par bshad pa mnyam dang mi nyam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The equal and unequal days, etc.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mthar thug pa mnyam pa'i nyin zhag rnams kyis g-yas dang / gcig la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi mthar thug pa mi mnyam pa'i nyin zhag rnams kyi g-yon la ste de 'chi ba rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mthar thug pa mnyam pa'i nyin zhag rnams kyis g-yas dang / gcig la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi mthar thug pa mi mnyam pa'i nyin zhag rnams kyi g-yon la ste de 'chi ba rgyu'o //
translated: The equal days, from the second up to the thirty-second, are in the right channel, and the unequal days, from the first up to the thirty-third, are in the left channel. This is the cause of death.

original: ci zhe na skye ba'i dus su skyes pa glang la sogs pa'i @271a * //
analyzed: ci zhe na skye ba'i dus su skyes pa glang la sogs pa'i @271a * //
translated: What is that? At the time of birth, the mandala of any of the zodiacs such as Taurus, etc.,

original: dus sbyor gyi sa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin du lug la sogs pa'i dus sbyor gyi stong pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyis te de'i dkyil 'khor nas brtsams te zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dus sbyor gyi sa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin du lug la sogs pa'i dus sbyor gyi stong pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyis te de'i dkyil 'khor nas brtsams te zhes pa'i don to //
translated: and likewise, the mandala of any of the zodiacs such as Aries, etc., are empty.

original: 'di yang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi rtsa khams dang phung po la sogs pa'i 'bab pa rnams bar nyams pa'i dbang du byas te lag pa phyis pa na ste spyir btang ba'i ai byas pa la zas lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi rtsa khams dang phung po la sogs pa'i 'bab pa rnams bar nyams pa'i dbang du byas te lag pa phyis pa na ste spyir btang ba'i ai byas pa la zas lnga pa'o //
translated: This is also in terms of the decline of the flow of the right and left channels, elements, aggregates, etc.

original: 'thad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'thad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: gzhan du 'chi bar mi 'gyur te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'chi bar mi 'gyur te zhes pa'o //
translated: “death does not occur otherwise.”

original: 'dis 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis 'di gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said by this.

original: mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa'i dang po nyin zhag gnyis g-yas pa la 'bab po //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa'i dang po nyin zhag gnyis g-yas pa la 'bab po //
translated: At the time of the equal zodiac, the first two days flow in the right.

original: slar yang nyin zhag gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: slar yang nyin zhag gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Again, two days as before.

original: de nas nyin zhag g-yon pa la 'bab po //
analyzed: de nas nyin zhag g-yon pa la 'bab po //
translated: Then, for one day and night, the downward flow.

original: nyin zhag gcig ji lta ba bzhin du'o //🔽nyin zhag bzhi g-yas pa la'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig ji lta ba bzhin du'o // nyin zhag bzhi g-yas pa la'o //
translated: As for one day and night,🔽for four days and nights, the right.

original: bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du'o //🔽gsum g-yon pa la'o //
analyzed: bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du'o // gsum g-yon pa la'o //
translated: As for four,🔽for three days and nights, the left.

original: gsum ji lta ba bzhin du'o //🔽drug g-yas pa la'o //
analyzed: gsum ji lta ba bzhin du'o // drug g-yas pa la'o //
translated: As for three,🔽for six days and nights, the right.

original: drug ji lta ba bzhin du'o //🔽lnga g-yon pa la'o //
analyzed: drug ji lta ba bzhin du'o // lnga g-yon pa la'o //
translated: As for six,🔽for five days and nights, the left.

original: lnga ji lta ba bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gnyis g-yas la'o //
analyzed: lnga ji lta ba bzhin no // de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gnyis g-yas la'o //
translated: As for five,🔽in the same way, for thirty-two days and nights, the right.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: As for thirty-two,🔽for thirty-three days and nights, the left.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum g-yon pa la'o ;🔽/ sum cu rtsa gsum ji lta ba bzhin du'o zhes pa'i par du'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum g-yon pa la'o ; / sum cu rtsa gsum ji lta ba bzhin du'o zhes pa'i par du'o //
translated: As for thirty-three,

original: 'dir g-yas pa la gnyis la sogs pa sum cu'i mthar thug pa mnyam pa'i nyin zhag gsum gsum gyi rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams zad do //
analyzed: 'dir g-yas pa la gnyis la sogs pa sum cu'i mthar thug pa mnyam pa'i nyin zhag gsum gsum gyi rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams zad do //
translated: Here, the elements of earth, etc., are exhausted by the downward flow, in the order of three days and nights each, from two days and nights up to thirty.

original: g-yon pa la gcig la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa dgu'i mthar thug pa mi mnyam pa'i nyin zhag gsum gsum gyi rim pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams zad do //
analyzed: g-yon pa la gcig la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa dgu'i mthar thug pa mi mnyam pa'i nyin zhag gsum gsum gyi rim pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i khams zad do //
translated: In the left nostril, the air element and so on are exhausted in three days and nights each, in the order of one, three, five, seven, nine, eleven, thirteen, fifteen, seventeen, nineteen, twenty-one, twenty-three, twenty-five, twenty-seven, twenty-nine.

original: de la nyin zhag gsum cu rtsa gcig gis snying stobs kyi khams zad do //
analyzed: de la nyin zhag gsum cu rtsa gcig gis snying stobs kyi khams zad do //
translated: In this way, the air element is exhausted in thirty-one days and nights.

original: nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis rdul gyi khams zad do //
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis rdul gyi khams zad do //
translated: The fire element is exhausted in thirty-two days and nights.🔽The water element is exhausted in thirty-three days and nights.

original: nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyis mun pa'i khams zad do //
analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyis mun pa'i khams zad do //
translated: The earth element is exhausted in thirty-four days and nights.

original: mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa rnams kyi ni gcig la sogs pa'i rim pas 'di 'bab po zhes pa khyad par ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa rnams kyi ni gcig la sogs pa'i rim pas 'di 'bab po zhes pa khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that for those born in an uneven period, it flows in the order of one and so on.

original: de ltar nyin zhag gsum gyis dman pa'i lo brgya ste de'i steng du nyin zhag gsum cu rtsa bzhi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag gsum gyis dman pa'i lo brgya ste de'i steng du nyin zhag gsum cu rtsa bzhi rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, there are one hundred years minus three days, plus thirty-four days.

original: de la nyin zhag gcig g-yas pa la'o //
analyzed: de la nyin zhag gcig g-yas pa la'o //
translated: In this, one day is in the right nostril.

original: @271b nyin zhag gcig g-yon pa la'o //
analyzed: @271b nyin zhag gcig g-yon pa la'o //
translated: One day is in the left nostril.

original: de lta bzhin du rim pas nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du 'bab ste de las rim pa khams dang phung po dang yul dang dbang po dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba dang / las kyi dbang po lnga rnams zad do //
analyzed: de lta bzhin du rim pas nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du 'bab ste de las rim pa khams dang phung po dang yul dang dbang po dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba dang / las kyi dbang po lnga rnams zad do //
translated: In the same way, it falls in stages for thirty-three days, and from that, the stages of the elements, aggregates, objects, faculties, and the activities of the faculties of action, and the five faculties of action are exhausted.

original: de nas dbu ma la nyin zhag gcig ste de las khams dang phung po la sogs pa drug pa rnams bskams nas srid pa gzhan du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas dbu ma la nyin zhag gcig ste de las khams dang phung po la sogs pa drug pa rnams bskams nas srid pa gzhan du 'gro'o //
translated: Then, for one day in the central nāḍī, after the elements, aggregates, and so on, are dried up, one goes to another existence.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pas 'chi ltas kyi mtshan nyid shes nas de slu ba'i thabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pas 'chi ltas kyi mtshan nyid shes nas de slu ba'i thabs gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, after the yogi/nī knows the characteristics of the signs of death, the method of deceiving them is explained.

original: 'chi ltas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la nyi ma'i 'chi ltas su gyur na rdo rje skyil krung bcings nas srog rtsol sngon du 'gro bas dpung pa g-yas pa nu ma g-yas pa btsir ba las dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'i bdag nyid g-yas pa las bkug ste g-yon pa la srog yang dag par
analyzed: 'chi ltas zhes pa la sogs pa'o // de la nyi ma'i 'chi ltas su gyur na rdo rje skyil krung bcings nas srog rtsol sngon du 'gro bas dpung pa g-yas pa nu ma g-yas pa btsir ba las dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pa'i bdag nyid g-yas pa las bkug ste g-yon pa la srog yang dag par
translated: The signs of death are as follows:

original: rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: If the signs of death of the sun occur, having bound the vajra position, having performed prāṇāyāma beforehand, the right elbow presses on the right breast, and the bindu that falls from the right side, the nature of the five maṇḍalas, is drawn up and the life [vayu] is caused to enter the left [nāḍī].

original: des nyi ma'i 'chi ltas ldog go //
analyzed: des nyi ma'i 'chi ltas ldog go //
translated: That reverses the death omens of the sun.

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa las g-yas pa la zla ba'i 'chi ltas ldog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa las g-yas pa la zla ba'i 'chi ltas ldog go //
translated: Similarly, from the left to the right, the death omens of the moon are reversed.

original: de bzhin du skyil krung byas nas thig ler te dpral bar gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug dkar po'i dbus su srog rtsol sngon du 'gro bas sems gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyil krung byas nas thig ler te dpral bar gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug dkar po'i dbus su srog rtsol sngon du 'gro bas sems gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, having made the full lotus posture, one should place the mind in the drop, that is, in the center of the white sixteen-petal lotus located in the forehead, preceded by prāṇāyāma.

original: srog ni thig ler gzhug par bya //
analyzed: srog ni thig ler gzhug par bya //
translated: The life-force should be placed in the drop.

original: zhes pa gtso bor 'dzin ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa gtso bor 'dzin ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of the principal retention.

original: 'di ni bsnyen pa'i yang gtso bo ste 'chi ltas slu ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bsnyen pa'i yang gtso bo ste 'chi ltas slu ba'i thabs so //
translated: This is also the principal approach, the method of deceiving the death omens.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung yang de'i dgongs pa nyid kyis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung yang de'i dgongs pa nyid kyis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The passage beginning “In the avadhūti” should be applied by the same intention.

original: de bzhin du skyil krung bcings nas aa wa dh'u di'i zhabs ni lte ba'i padma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa ser bo ste de'i dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la aam yig dkar po'i steng du re kha'i rnam pa de dang rab tu sbyor ba bsgom par bya'o
analyzed: de bzhin du skyil krung bcings nas aa wa dh'u di'i zhabs ni lte ba'i padma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa ser bo ste de'i dbus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la aam yig dkar po'i steng du re kha'i rnam pa de dang rab tu sbyor ba bsgom par bya'o
translated: Likewise, having bound the knees in the vajra position, one should meditate on the union of the foot of the avadhūtī and the yellow navel cakra of sixty-four petals, in the center of which is a moon maṇḍala, upon which is a white aṃ, the form of a line.

original: // de bzhin du rtag tu rdo rje bslang bar bya rang gi lag pa'i mtsho skyes la sogs pas ji ltar thig le phyi rol du mi 'byung bar te 'chi ltas kyi rgyu zla nyi'i bgrod pa 'joms pa las so //
analyzed: // de bzhin du rtag tu rdo rje bslang bar bya rang gi lag pa'i mtsho skyes la sogs pas ji ltar thig le phyi rol du mi 'byung bar te 'chi ltas kyi rgyu zla nyi'i bgrod pa 'joms pa las so //
translated: Likewise, one should always raise the vajra, with one’s own hand, and so on, in order to prevent the bindu from falling outside, that is, from the destruction of the path of the moon and sun, the cause of the signs of death.

original: thabs 'di gtso bor gsungs pa /🔽gzhan du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs 'di gtso bor gsungs pa / gzhan du zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This method is said to be primary.

original: steng gi 'chi ltas slu ba brjod nas /
analyzed: steng gi 'chi ltas slu ba brjod nas /
translated: Having described the deception of the upper signs of death,

original: 'og gi 'chi ltas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'og gi 'chi ltas gsungs pa /
translated: the lower signs of death are mentioned.

original: 'og tu'ang dung can mar thur sel zhes pa ste 'og tu yang dung can ma'i rtsa 'ba' zhig la ma yin par bshad @272a * //
analyzed: 'og tu'ang dung can mar thur sel zhes pa ste 'og tu yang dung can ma'i rtsa 'ba' zhig la ma yin par bshad @272a * //
translated: “Also below, the conch moves into the avadhūtī” means that it is explained that it is not only in the avadhūtī channel that the conch moves.

original: ba dang gci ba 'bab pa dag thur sel zhes bya ba'i rlung 'bab na zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ba dang gci ba 'bab pa dag thur sel zhes bya ba'i rlung 'bab na zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is: “When the wind called ‘evacuative’ blows, urine and feces flow down.”

original: rgyun du bshad pa dang gci ba 'bab pa nyid kyis de ma zhugs pa las kyang 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun du bshad pa dang gci ba 'bab pa nyid kyis de ma zhugs pa las kyang 'chi ba'o //
translated: By the mere flow of urine and feces, death occurs even without the wind entering.

original: de la 'chi ltas slu ba'i thabs kyi zol gyis dga' ba rnams 'chi ltas zhes pa la sogs pas mdor bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'chi ltas slu ba'i thabs kyi zol gyis dga' ba rnams 'chi ltas zhes pa la sogs pas mdor bstan te /
translated: There, the signs of death are explained by the pretense of a method of deception, beginning with “The signs of death are the joys. ”

original: mgo bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo'i zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The head, etc., is explained extensively, beginning with “The lotus of the head. ”

original: gtsug tor gyi padma 'dab ma bzhi pa'i dbus las dpral ba'i chu skyes 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i dbus su khu ba dga' ba dang bzang po dang rgyal ba dang stong pa dang rdzogs pa zhes bya ba cha lngas 'ongs pa gnyis ka la khyab pa ni dang
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi padma 'dab ma bzhi pa'i dbus las dpral ba'i chu skyes 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i dbus su khu ba dga' ba dang bzang po dang rgyal ba dang stong pa dang rdzogs pa zhes bya ba cha lngas 'ongs pa gnyis ka la khyab pa ni dang
translated: From the center of the four-petaled lotus of the uṣṇīṣa, the semen arrives in the center of the sixteen-petaled lotus of the forehead with five parts called joy, bliss, victory, emptiness, and perfection. The pervasion of both is

original: po dga' ba'o //
analyzed: po dga' ba'o //
translated: the first joy.

original: de nas mgrin pa snying gar mchog dga' zhes pa mgrin pa'i chu skyes 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las snying ga'i padma 'dab ma brgyad par snga ma bzhin khyab pa mchog dga'o //
analyzed: de nas mgrin pa snying gar mchog dga' zhes pa mgrin pa'i chu skyes 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las snying ga'i padma 'dab ma brgyad par snga ma bzhin khyab pa mchog dga'o //
translated: Then, the throat to the heart is the supreme joy. From the thirty-two-petaled lotus of the throat, the eight-petaled lotus of the heart is pervaded as before. That is the supreme joy.

original: dga' bral dga' ba de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba de nas 'gyur //
translated: The joy of separation from joy arises from that.

original: zhes pa lte ba'i padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa las gsang ba'i chu skyes 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis par khyab pa dga' bral dga' ba'o //🔽de yang sna tshogs dga' ba dam por 'khyud pa dang / sh'ati yig dang mgrin pa'i k'u dza na la sogs pa lte ba dang gsang bar yang phyi rol rtogs pa kha phyir phyogs pa'i bde ba zos pa ste bdag gis zhes rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid rang rig pa tsam dga' ba'i mthar thug pa skye ba yin gyi dga'
analyzed: zhes pa lte ba'i padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa las gsang ba'i chu skyes 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis par khyab pa dga' bral dga' ba'o // de yang sna tshogs dga' ba dam por 'khyud pa dang / sh'ati yig dang mgrin pa'i k'u dza na la sogs pa lte ba dang gsang bar yang phyi rol rtogs pa kha phyir phyogs pa'i bde ba zos pa ste bdag gis zhes rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid rang rig pa tsam dga' ba'i mthar thug pa skye ba yin gyi dga'
translated: From the sixty-four-petaled lotus of the navel, the thirty-two-petaled secret lotus is pervaded. That is the joy of separation from joy.

original: ba dang bral ba'i bde ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba dang bral ba'i bde ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the supreme joy of variety is the experience of the bliss of the external concepts that face outward, such as the embrace, the śrī heruka, and so on, of the throat, and the kuñjala of the navel and the secret place. That is to say, it is the arising of the mere self-awareness that has the characteristic of the realization “I have experienced” at the conclusion of the joy. It is not the bliss of separation from joy.

original: de nas gsang ba'i padma nas rdo rje nor bu'i nang du gnas pa'i chu skyes 'dab ma brgyad pa'i bar du mi g-yo ba'i cha bcu drug pa 'ongs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i padma nas rdo rje nor bu'i nang du gnas pa'i chu skyes 'dab ma brgyad pa'i bar du mi g-yo ba'i cha bcu drug pa 'ongs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste /
translated: Then, from the secret lotus up to the eight-petaled lotus in the jewel of the vajra, the sixteen parts of immobility come, which is the innate joy.

original: 'dzin pa'i stobs kyi phyi rol du bgrod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i stobs kyi phyi rol du bgrod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: It is unmoving because there is no external movement due to the power of retention.

original: 'dod chags bral las te chags pa'i dga' ba dang bral ba las gtsug tor du gnas pa'i bde ba ste khu ba gang yin pa de rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral las te chags pa'i dga' ba dang bral ba las gtsug tor du gnas pa'i bde ba ste khu ba gang yin pa de rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The bliss that abides in the crown, which is the semen, is well-abiding, due to the absence of passion, the absence of the joy of passion.

original: rdo rje nor bu las 'pho ba med pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nor bu las 'pho ba med pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The non-emission from the vajra jewel is nirvana.

original: bde ba'i rgyal po 'di ni gtsug tor dang rdo rje nor bu'i bar du khyab pa'i phyir rab tu mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyal po 'di ni gtsug tor dang rdo rje nor bu'i bar du khyab pa'i phyir rab tu mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa yin no //
translated: Since this king of bliss pervades the area between the crown and the vajra jewel, it is the non-abiding nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chags chen dang mi 'gyur ba yang ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chags chen dang mi 'gyur ba yang ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is also the great passion and the unchanging.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir khyab bdag 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang phyug @272b ste thams cad de'i gnas 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir khyab bdag 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang phyug @272b ste thams cad de'i gnas 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the principal, it is the lord of the three worlds, since everything is its abode, and is desired and wished for.

original: bdud rtsi yin pa nyid kyi phyir khu ba nyid zla ba ste khu ba zla ba de'i gtsug tor du 'char ba ni dkar po'i tshes gcig ste gsang bar rdzogs pa gsum pa ji srid par ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi yin pa nyid kyi phyir khu ba nyid zla ba ste khu ba zla ba de'i gtsug tor du 'char ba ni dkar po'i tshes gcig ste gsang bar rdzogs pa gsum pa ji srid par ro //
translated: Since it is nectar, the semen is the moon. The rising of that moon in the crown of the head is the first day of the bright fortnight, for as long as the third is perfected in the secret place.

original: 'dir byang chub kyi sems la dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rdzogs pa gsum du 'gyur te gsang bar dga' bral dga' ba las ni /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub kyi sems la dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rdzogs pa gsum du 'gyur te gsang bar dga' bral dga' ba las ni /
translated: Here, the bodhicitta becomes the three perfections by the divisions of joy and so on. In the secret place, the joy of the separation from joy

original: bcu drug cha gang de nor bu'i //🔽padma rdo rje'i rtse mor gnas //
analyzed: bcu drug cha gang de nor bu'i // padma rdo rje'i rtse mor gnas //
translated: is the sixteenth part, which is the jewel🔽that abides at the tip of the lotus and vajra.

original: rdo rje'i rtse mo'i mthar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rtse mo'i mthar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It abides at the tip of the vajra.

original: de las steng du nag po'i tshes gcig 'ongs pa na ste chags bral rab tu zhugs pa'i dus su 'gyur te 'pho ba'i dus nyid nag po'i tshe gcig go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las steng du nag po'i tshes gcig 'ongs pa na ste chags bral rab tu zhugs pa'i dus su 'gyur te 'pho ba'i dus nyid nag po'i tshe gcig go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, when the first day of the dark half comes, that is, when one has entered into the highest separation from passion, that is the time of the transmigration, the first day of the dark half.

original: de ni 'dod chags nyams pa'i phyir nag po'i phyogs te rdul gyi gzugs kyis nyi ma'i cha dang po nor bu'i rtse mo la'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags nyams pa'i phyir nag po'i phyogs te rdul gyi gzugs kyis nyi ma'i cha dang po nor bu'i rtse mo la'o //
translated: That is the dark half because of the waning of passion, the first part of the sun by the form of the dust on the tip of the jewel.

original: de nas 'dod chags bral bas nyi ma mdzod spu'i gnas dpral bar 'gro ste gnam stong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nas 'dod chags bral bas nyi ma mdzod spu'i gnas dpral bar 'gro ste gnam stong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, because of the separation from passion, the sun goes to the place of the ūrṇā, the forehead, the new moon.🔽Then,

original: de nas / nyi ma'i cha shas bcu drug ma //
analyzed: de nas / nyi ma'i cha shas bcu drug ma //
translated: the sixteen parts of the sun

original: gtsug tor padmar son pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor padmar son pa'o //
translated: are in the uṣṇīṣa lotus.

original: de nyid zla ba nyams pa zhes pa brjod de nyi mas rdul gyi gzugs kyis bkab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid zla ba nyams pa zhes pa brjod de nyi mas rdul gyi gzugs kyis bkab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is called the waning moon because it is covered by the sun by the form of the dust.

original: chags pa'i bde ba la chags bral phyir yang de nyid do //
analyzed: chags pa'i bde ba la chags bral phyir yang de nyid do //
translated: It is also that because of the separation from the bliss of passion.

original: lus can thams cad de lha dang lha ma yin dang mi la sogs pa rnams 'chi ba na ste 'chi ba'i dus su zla ba bdud rtsi 'og tu 'gro zhes pa zla ba bdud rtsi byang chub kyis sems 'pho ba'i chags pa goms pa las brjod pa'i rim
analyzed: lus can thams cad de lha dang lha ma yin dang mi la sogs pa rnams 'chi ba na ste 'chi ba'i dus su zla ba bdud rtsi 'og tu 'gro zhes pa zla ba bdud rtsi byang chub kyis sems 'pho ba'i chags pa goms pa las brjod pa'i rim
translated: When all embodied beings—gods, demigods, humans, and so on—die, at the time of death, the moon, the nectar, moves below.🔽

original: pas 'og tu khu ba'i lam nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: pas 'og tu khu ba'i lam nas 'gro'o //
translated: When all embodied beings, gods, demigods, humans, etc., die, at the time of death, the moon, the nectar, goes below. The moon, the nectar, the bodhicitta, moves by the process described from the practice of passion, and goes below through the path of the semen.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma rdul steng du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma rdul steng du 'gro'o //
translated: Likewise, the sun, the emission, goes above.

original: sgra gcan mi shes pa ma rig pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig stobs dang ldan pa'i srog dang bcas pa'i rnam shes 'di dngos po'i mtshan nyid la ste dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi sprul pa'i skye ba gzhan du 'gro'o //
analyzed: sgra gcan mi shes pa ma rig pa'i bag chags dang lhan cig stobs dang ldan pa'i srog dang bcas pa'i rnam shes 'di dngos po'i mtshan nyid la ste dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi sprul pa'i skye ba gzhan du 'gro'o //
translated: Rahu, the powerful consciousness endowed with life, together with the latent tendencies of ignorance, goes to another birth, an emanation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, to the characteristics of entities.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir zla ba bdud rtsi khu ba'i khams ni brjod pa'i lam bsgoms pas steng du ste gyen du bgrod pa dang / 'og tu yang nyi ma rdul bgrod pa dang / sgra gcan gyi mtshan nyid rnam shes 'gyur med bde ba la bgrod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir zla ba bdud rtsi khu ba'i khams ni brjod pa'i lam bsgoms pas steng du ste gyen du bgrod pa dang / 'og tu yang nyi ma rdul bgrod pa dang / sgra gcan gyi mtshan nyid rnam shes 'gyur med bde ba la bgrod par bya'o //
translated: For that reason, the lunar nectar element should be made to ascend, i.e., move upward, by the practice of the path of expression, and the solar dust should be made to descend, and Rāhu, i.e., the unchanging consciousness of bliss, should be made to move.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sngon 'di mdzad do zhes pa la sogs pa ston pa sangs rgyas zhes pa la @273a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sngon 'di mdzad do zhes pa la sogs pa ston pa sangs rgyas zhes pa la @273a * //
translated: The Blessed One also did this before, and so on.

original: sogs pa'o // sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni zla ba bdud rtsi nya ste cha bco lnga yongs su rdzogs pa nyid mdzod spu'i padmar te dbral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'o // sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni zla ba bdud rtsi nya ste cha bco lnga yongs su rdzogs pa nyid mdzod spu'i padmar te dbral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moon, i.e., the nectar of the buddhas, is the fifteenth digit, which is complete, in the lotus of the ūrṇā, i.e., the forehead.

original: nyi rdul gnam stong gsang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi rdul gnam stong gsang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The solar dust is the new moon in the secret place.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi de dag ste zla ba dang nyi ma cha bcu drug pa dag rim pa ji lta bas gtsug tor dang rdo rje nor bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi de dag ste zla ba dang nyi ma cha bcu drug pa dag rim pa ji lta bas gtsug tor dang rdo rje nor bu'o //
translated: Those of the buddhas, i.e., the moon and sun, the sixteenth digit, become the uṣṇīṣa and the vajra jewel, respectively.

original: de mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa /
translated: The recitation of the name is stated in the Tathāgataguhyaka:

original: rkang pa gcig gis mthil gnon pa //
analyzed: rkang pa gcig gis mthil gnon pa //
translated: The sole of the foot is pressed down,

original: sa yi snying po mthil gnas pa //
analyzed: sa yi snying po mthil gnas pa //
translated: the essence of the earth is pressed down,

original: tshangs pa'i sgo nga'i rtse mo gnon //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgo nga'i rtse mo gnon //
translated: the peak of the egg of Brahmā is pressed down,

original: rkang mtheb sen mo la gnas pa //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rkang mtheb sen mo la gnas pa // zhes pa ste /
translated: the nail of the toe is pressed down.

original: brjod pa ni rdo rje'i tshig ste bgrod par bya ba dang rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni rdo rje'i tshig ste bgrod par bya ba dang rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The recitation is the vajra word, that which is to be traversed and realized.

original: gang gis tshig mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes de'i zhabs la tshig gi sgrub byed spyi bos rtag tu phyag 'tshal ba'o zhes pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis tshig mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes de'i zhabs la tshig gi sgrub byed spyi bos rtag tu phyag 'tshal ba'o zhes pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes ni ston pa'o //
translated: By whom the word is the unchanging intuition, at whose feet the general means of verbal establishment is always bowed down to with the head—this is the non-dual intuition, the teacher.

original: lus can kun gyi zhes pa 'khor ba pa thams cad kyi phyin ci log la rab tu gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus can kun gyi zhes pa 'khor ba pa thams cad kyi phyin ci log la rab tu gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Of all embodied beings” means not abiding in the error of all transmigrators.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / rab gnas mya ngan 'das pa mi na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rab gnas mya ngan 'das pa mi na //
translated: “abiding in nirvāṇa is not”

original: zhes bya ba bde ba chen po'i ming can lus dag pa las sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams phyin ci log sgrib pa 'bad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bde ba chen po'i ming can lus dag pa las sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams phyin ci log sgrib pa 'bad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the name of great bliss, from the purification of the body, the elements such as earth and so on are not the error of obscuration and effort.

original: khams gzhan de rnams dbyer med pa 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis rang nyams su rab tu 'jug pa'i gtum mo 'bar ba las dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas spyi bo las babs pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems ye shes kyi thig le rnams brjod pa'i rims pas phyi
analyzed: khams gzhan de rnams dbyer med pa 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis rang nyams su rab tu 'jug pa'i gtum mo 'bar ba las dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas spyi bo las babs pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems ye shes kyi thig le rnams brjod pa'i rims pas phyi
translated: The other elements are inseparable, and by the power of apprehending them, the blazing of the inner heat that engages one’s own experience causes the bindu of gnosis of body, voice, and mind to descend from the crown.

original: rol du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba rdzogs pa rnams kyi sku bzhi'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rol du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba rdzogs pa rnams kyi sku bzhi'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Since the divisions of joy and so on do not exist externally, the four kāyas of the perfected, unchanging bliss are explained.

original: nor bur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nor bur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In the jewel” and so on.

original: bde chen las zhes pa bde ba chen po'i ming can dag pa'i sku las te phyin ci log gis sku'i thig le gang yin pa de bzhin pa'i gnas skabs zad pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: bde chen las zhes pa bde ba chen po'i ming can dag pa'i sku las te phyin ci log gis sku'i thig le gang yin pa de bzhin pa'i gnas skabs zad pa'i sku ste /
translated: “From the great bliss” means from the pure kāya that is called “great bliss.” The bindu of the kāya that is the opposite of that is the kāya that is the exhaustion of the state of suchness.

original: de yang rdo rje rtse mor gnas so //🔽de las nor bur thugs shin tu gnyid log zad par las so //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje rtse mor gnas so // de las nor bur thugs shin tu gnyid log zad par las so //
translated: Moreover, it is located at the tip of the vajra.🔽From that, the mind falls asleep in the jewel, exhausted.

original: gsang bar rmi lam zad par las so //
analyzed: gsang bar rmi lam zad par las so //
translated: From that, dreams are exhausted in the secret place.

original: lte bar sku sad pa'i gnas skabs zad pa las so //
analyzed: lte bar sku sad pa'i gnas skabs zad pa las so //
translated: At the navel, the emanation of the body, the state of awakening, is from the exhaustion of the occasion.

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku 'di rnams kyang dag pa'i sku las spro ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku 'di rnams kyang dag pa'i sku las spro ba'o //
translated: These bodies of Dharma, enjoyment, and emanation are emanations from the pure body.

original: thabs kyi 'og tu zhes pa rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo las chos kyi sku la sogs pa @273b 'di rnams kyi spro ba gang yin pa de thabs kyi cha'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi 'og tu zhes pa rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo las chos kyi sku la sogs pa @273b 'di rnams kyi spro ba gang yin pa de thabs kyi cha'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The emanation of these, Dharma body, etc., from the tip of the vajra jewel, is the method part.

original: shes rab kyi ni slar yang steng du 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni slar yang steng du 'gyur te /
translated: The emanation of this wisdom is above,

original: de ston pa 'di'i zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa 'di'i zhes pa'o //
translated: and that is taught here.

original: shes rab 'di'i sprul pa zhes bya ba sku rdo rje dpral bar te snga ma bzhin du phyin ci log gis so //
analyzed: shes rab 'di'i sprul pa zhes bya ba sku rdo rje dpral bar te snga ma bzhin du phyin ci log gis so //
translated: The emanation of this wisdom is the body vajra at the forehead, as before, by the reversal.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: mgrin snying lte ba'i 'dab skyes la //
analyzed: mgrin snying lte ba'i 'dab skyes la //
translated: at the throat, heart, and navel cakras,

original: rim pa ji lta bas gsung thugs ye shes rdo rje rnams ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku rnams te shes rab kyi cha'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bas gsung thugs ye shes rdo rje rnams ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku rnams te shes rab kyi cha'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the speech, mind, and gnosis vajras are the enjoyment, Dharma, and innate bodies, respectively, the arrangement of the wisdom part.

original: de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid de rdo rje sems dpa'i sku las phung po la sogs pa rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid kyi sems can gyi ched du spro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid de rdo rje sems dpa'i sku las phung po la sogs pa rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid kyi sems can gyi ched du spro ba'o //
translated: Likewise, from the body of Vajrasattva, who is the nature of wisdom and means, the aggregates and so forth are emanated in the form of Vairochana and so forth for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni don gyis rjes su dran pa'i yan lag mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni don gyis rjes su dran pa'i yan lag mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief indication of the branch of recollection of the meaning.

original: 'bras bu mdor bstan nas de sgrub thabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu mdor bstan nas de sgrub thabs gsungs pa /
translated: Having briefly indicated the result, he teaches the means of achieving it:

original: las kyi phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action seal, etc.

original: las kyi phyag ni nu ma dang skrar ldan pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi bde ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag ni nu ma dang skrar ldan pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi bde ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The action seal is endowed with breasts and hair, the cause of the bliss of the desire realm.

original: las ni tsumba na dang 'khyud pa dang gsang bar reg pa dang rdo rje bskyod pa la sogs pa bya ba'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: las ni tsumba na dang 'khyud pa dang gsang bar reg pa dang rdo rje bskyod pa la sogs pa bya ba'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Action is the nature of the activities such as kissing, embracing, touching the secret place, shaking the vajra, and so forth.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i phyag rgya ni yid ches pa byed pa mo yin la yid ches pa ni 'dir 'gyur ba'i bde ba mtshon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i phyag rgya ni yid ches pa byed pa mo yin la yid ches pa ni 'dir 'gyur ba'i bde ba mtshon par byed pa ste /
translated: The seal illustrated by that is the one who causes confidence, and confidence here is the one who illustrates the bliss of transformation.

original: mu dam bde ba'i khyad par r'a ste ster ba'o zhes pa phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mu dam bde ba'i khyad par r'a ste ster ba'o zhes pa phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra is the special bliss, the ra, which is given.

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa sna tshogs yum la tshogs pa lha mo'i rang bzhin rjes su longs spyod pa ji srid par te gzugs kyi khams kyi bde ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya ni rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa sna tshogs yum la tshogs pa lha mo'i rang bzhin rjes su longs spyod pa ji srid par te gzugs kyi khams kyi bde ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The wisdom mudra is the various ones imagined by one’s mind, the nature of the assembly of goddesses, which is enjoyed as long as the cause of bliss in the form realm.

original: ye shes ni sngon dgong pa dang blta ba la sogs pa bsgoms pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ye shes ni sngon dgong pa dang blta ba la sogs pa bsgoms pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Wisdom is the nature of meditation on the prior longing and seeing, etc.

original: yid ches pa ni 'dir g-yo ba'i bde ba mtshan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa ni 'dir g-yo ba'i bde ba mtshan par byed pa'o //
translated: Confidence is the mark of the moving bliss here.

original: chen po yang 'di yin la phyag rgya yang yin pas phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po yang 'di yin la phyag rgya yang yin pas phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: It is the great one and it is the mudra, thus it is the great mudra.

original: slar yang 'di'i chen po nyid ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nyi tshe ba ma yin pa nyid yin la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dis rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: slar yang 'di'i chen po nyid ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nyi tshe ba ma yin pa nyid yin la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dis rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir phyag rgya ste /
translated: Moreover, its greatness is the possession of the best of all aspects, and it is not limited. It is the mudra because it seals with this vajra of the thought of awakening.

original: yid ches pa ni 'dir rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos dang bral ba du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sngon du 'gro ba'i rang gi sems rab tu gsal ba rnal 'byor bas rtogs par bya ba pra phab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa ni 'dir rang gi sems kyis yongs su brtags pa'i chos dang bral ba du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma sngon du 'gro ba'i rang gi sems rab tu gsal ba rnal 'byor bas rtogs par bya ba pra phab pa lta bu'o //
translated: Confidence is the yogi's realization of his own mind, which is clear, preceded by the signs of smoke, etc., free from the dharmas imagined by his own mind, like a mirror-divination.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo @274a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo @274a * //
translated: The nature of the result

original: bo phyag rgya chen po ni mu dam mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de r'a ti gang ba'i gnas skabs mi g-yo ba'i sbyor bas dus thams cad kun nas ster ba'o zhes pa phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bo phyag rgya chen po ni mu dam mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de r'a ti gang ba'i gnas skabs mi g-yo ba'i sbyor bas dus thams cad kun nas ster ba'o zhes pa phyag rgya'o //
translated: is the Great Seal, the gnosis of supreme unchanging bliss, which is the state of the vessel filled with rati, the bestowal of all at all times by the yoga of immobility.

original: 'di'i chen po nyid kyang spangs pa chen po nyid dang rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di'i chen po nyid kyang spangs pa chen po nyid dang rtogs pa chen po nyid kyis so //
translated: Its greatness is due to its great abandonment and great realization.

original: de la spangs pa chen po nyid ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i 'od gsal ba mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la spangs pa chen po nyid ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i 'od gsal ba mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therein, great abandonment is the characteristic of the abandonment of all obscurations together with their instincts, the characteristic of the realization of the clearlight, called the natural.

original: rtogs pa chen po nyid ni yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba cho sku mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa chen po nyid ni yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba cho sku mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The great realization is the nature of the realization of the body of the Dharma, called the “purified state of union of the nature of all Buddhas.”

original: gang zhig yid mun pa nyams pa la sogs pa dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa 'od gsal ba mngon sum du byed pa kho na sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag rtogs pas te ;
analyzed: gang zhig yid mun pa nyams pa la sogs pa dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa 'od gsal ba mngon sum du byed pa kho na sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag rtogs pas te ;
translated: The direct realization of the clear light, which is of one taste with emptiness like the sky, free from all stains such as the darkness of the mind, is the realization of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: ma lus pa'i rgyu ni sna tshogs pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa'i nus pa'i ngo bos de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i rgyu ni sna tshogs pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa'i nus pa'i ngo bos de la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The cause of that is the existence of all the qualities of the Buddha in the essence of the potential for the accomplishment of the various aims.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos rnams kyi rten gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos rnams kyi rten gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o zhes brjod do //
translated: For that very reason, the body that is the support of the qualities is called the body of the Dharma.

original: de la yang rab tu snang ba ma yin na yang rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa yin na bum pa rab tu snang ba na snam bu la sogs pa rtogs par thal ba bzlog par dka' ste /
analyzed: de la yang rab tu snang ba ma yin na yang rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa yin na bum pa rab tu snang ba na snam bu la sogs pa rtogs par thal ba bzlog par dka' ste /
translated: If it is posited that it is realized even when it is not clearly manifest, then when a pot is clearly manifest, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that a cloth and so on are also realized.

original: gang yang grangs can pa'i lta ba sun ma phyung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang grangs can pa'i lta ba sun ma phyung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it would be impossible to refute the views of the Samkhyas.

original: gzhan yang sgyu ma rang rmi lam dang dri bra'i grong khyer dang bral bab la sogs pa bzhin du ma brtags pa'i phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ma lus pa mthong ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa mthong ba ste rang byin gyis brlab pa yang
analyzed: gzhan yang sgyu ma rang rmi lam dang dri bra'i grong khyer dang bral bab la sogs pa bzhin du ma brtags pa'i phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ma lus pa mthong ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa mthong ba ste rang byin gyis brlab pa yang
translated: Furthermore, seeing the aggregates, elements, sense spheres and so on without exception, which are not examined, is seeing conventional truth, like an illusion, a dream, a city of gandharvas and so on.

original: brjod do // kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kyang don dam pa'i dben pa'i bdag nyid 'od gsal ba yongs su dag med long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa brten pa'i tshogs dang khang pa brtsegs pa la sogs pa rten gyi
analyzed: brjod do // kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kyang don dam pa'i dben pa'i bdag nyid 'od gsal ba yongs su dag med long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa brten pa'i tshogs dang khang pa brtsegs pa la sogs pa rten gyi
translated: The relative truth is also the ultimate, the nature of clear light, the essence of the wisdom of the eye of the pure sky, etc., Vairochana, etc., the assembly of the supported, the mandala of the support, the palace, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor yang ste de nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid dang sngas rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis kyang rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang ste de nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid dang sngas rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis kyang rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad du gsungs so //
translated: That very [mandala] is the supramundane mandala, and the nature of the extensive Dharma, and is also taught in all the kings of tantras.

original: bden pa @274b gnyis gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin 'di nyid zung du 'jug pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bden pa @274b gnyis gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin 'di nyid zung du 'jug pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This very nature of the non-dual two truths is called the union.

original: de'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i sku nyid chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i sku nyid chos kyi sku ste /
translated: Therefore, the very body of the union is the Dharma body,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang rang bzhin dag las tha nad par gyur pa rnal 'byor pas so so rang gis rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang rang bzhin dag las tha nad par gyur pa rnal 'byor pas so so rang gis rig par bya ba'o //
translated: which is different from the enjoyment and the natural [bodies], and is to be individually cognized by the yogi.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dbal zhabs kyis kyang rgyud phyi mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dbal zhabs kyis kyang rgyud phyi mar gsungs pa /
translated: The noble Mañjuśrī also taught in the Later Tantra:

original: gang du yang dag min zhes bden par dkar po dge ba'i tshogs rnams rgyal ba rnams kyi chos kyi sku //
analyzed: gang du yang dag min zhes bden par dkar po dge ba'i tshogs rnams rgyal ba rnams kyi chos kyi sku //
translated: “Where there is no reality,” that is, where there is no truth, “the accumulations of virtue,” that is, the virtuous accumulations, “are the dharmakāya of the victors.”

original: chos la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste mtha' dag skad kyi tshogs so mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: chos la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste mtha' dag skad kyi tshogs so mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyi ni //
translated: “The enjoyment of the Dharma” is the sambhogakāya, “the collection of sounds” is the nirmāṇakāya, “the aggregates,” and “the signs and features” are the nirmāṇakāya.

original: phung po sprul pa'i sku ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba yi bde ba chos sku ma yin de yi phyir //
analyzed: phung po sprul pa'i sku ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba yi bde ba chos sku ma yin de yi phyir //
translated: “The supreme unchanging bliss” is not the dharmakāya.

original: sku rnams kyi ni mtshan nyid gang de 'dir ni bde bar gshegs dang 'phags pa klus bod kyis kyang ste //
analyzed: sku rnams kyi ni mtshan nyid gang de 'dir ni bde bar gshegs dang 'phags pa klus bod kyis kyang ste //
translated: “The characteristics of the kāyas,” that is, the characteristics of the dharmakāya and so on, “are taught here by the Sugata and the noble Nāgārjuna.”

original: gang zhig gcig min du ma yang min rang dang gzhan la phan pa phun tshogs chen po'i gzhir gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig gcig min du ma yang min rang dang gzhan la phan pa phun tshogs chen po'i gzhir gyur pa //
translated: “That which is neither one nor many, the basis of the great perfection of benefit for self and other,

original: dngos med nyid min dngos po ma yin nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam rtogs par dka' ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: dngos med nyid min dngos po ma yin nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam rtogs par dka' ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: is not a nonentity, not an entity, and has a nature that is difficult to realize, equal to space.”
