original: zhi zhing zhes pa khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: zhi zhing zhes pa khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral ba ste /
translated: Peaceful means free from the manifestations of the eighteen elements.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje snying po'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje snying po'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The noble Vajragarbha also says:

original: ngo bo gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa la rang @276b gi ngo bo ni rang rig par byed pa de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: ngo bo gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa la rang @276b gi ngo bo ni rang rig par byed pa de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: As for the statement “Its essence is formlessness,” its essence is the gnosis of suchness that makes it known to oneself.

original: rang gi ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral ba des rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyi rol gyi gzugs med mthong ba med mig gi rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral ba des rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyi rol gyi gzugs med mthong ba med mig gi rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: Since its essence is free from the manifestations of the eighteen elements of subject and object, yogins and yoginīs do not see external forms, nor do they have visual consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sgra med nyan pa med rna ba'i rnam par shes pa med do //🔽de bzhin du dri med snom pa med sna'i rnam par shes ba med do //🔽de bzhin du ro med myong ba'ang med lce'i rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra med nyan pa med rna ba'i rnam par shes pa med do // de bzhin du dri med snom pa med sna'i rnam par shes ba med do // de bzhin du ro med myong ba'ang med lce'i rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: Similarly, they do not hear sounds, nor do they have auditory consciousness.🔽They do not smell odors, nor do they have olfactory consciousness.🔽They do not experience tastes, nor do they have gustatory consciousness.

original: de bzhin du reg bya med reg par bya ba'ang med lus kyi rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya med reg par bya ba'ang med lus kyi rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: They do not feel tangible objects, nor do they have tactile consciousness.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi khams med 'dzin pa med yid kyi rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi khams med 'dzin pa med yid kyi rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: They do not apprehend mental phenomena, nor do they have mental consciousness.

original: de ltar khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral ba'i de kho na rin po che rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams bco brgyad kyi rnam 'gyur dang bral ba'i de kho na rin po che rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the yogin should meditate on the jewel, which is reality free from the modifications of the eighteen elements.

original: rnam par dben la zhes pa shes bya dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa las tha dad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dben la zhes pa shes bya dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa las tha dad par gyur pa'o //
translated: In the void, means in the void that is distinguished from the obscurations of the object of knowledge, meditative concentration, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba las shin tu brtags pa'i bdag nyid dang rgyus kyang mchog tu zhi ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba las shin tu brtags pa'i bdag nyid dang rgyus kyang mchog tu zhi ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is the nature that is well examined, free from all harm, and by cause, it is the nature of supreme peace.

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs bya nyid //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyis rtogs bya nyid //
translated: It is the very object of realization of the yogins.

original: ces pa rnal 'byor ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor yin la //
analyzed: ces pa rnal 'byor ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor yin la //
translated: The yogin is the yogin of the six-branched yoga.🔽The very object of realization of those who have attained the perfection of that yoga, the ultimate, is this.

original: gang la rnal 'byor de phul du byung ba mthar thug pa thob pa de rnams 'di rnal 'byor pa ste rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gnas thob pa de rnams kyi rtogs bya nyid do //
analyzed: gang la rnal 'byor de phul du byung ba mthar thug pa thob pa de rnams 'di rnal 'byor pa ste rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gnas thob pa de rnams kyi rtogs bya nyid do //
translated: The yogins are those who have attained the state of the Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i phyir rkyen gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa 'dis 'di'i so so rang gis rig par bya ba rab tu gsal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa 'dis 'di'i so so rang gis rig par bya ba rab tu gsal bar mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, this non-realization by other conditions clearly reveals its being an object of individual knowledge.

original: de ni gus pa dang rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'jug pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam bsgom pa phul du byung ba mthar thug pas rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gus pa dang rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'jug pa du ba la sogs pa'i lam bsgom pa phul du byung ba mthar thug pas rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir byis pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to be realized by the yogis of the stage of ordinary beings because it is to be realized by the culmination of the meditation on the path of smoke, etc., which is engaged in with devotion and without interruption.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas phul du byung ba'i 'bad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis kyang yongs su gcod par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dpyad dka' ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas phul du byung ba'i 'bad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis kyang yongs su gcod par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dpyad dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to analyze because it cannot be ascertained even by those who have the best effort, whose knowledge is of the nature of hearing and contemplation.

original: rang dang gzhan la phan pa zhes pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sbyor ba las mtha' gcig tu rang la phan pa dang bsam pa ji lta ba dang rigs ji lta bar yang de'i
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la phan pa zhes pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sbyor ba las mtha' gcig tu rang la phan pa dang bsam pa ji lta ba dang rigs ji lta bar yang de'i
translated: The benefit for oneself and others is the application of the perfection of one's own aim, which is the characteristic of abandoning all obscurations together with their habitual tendencies.🔽

original: @277a * // byin rlabs las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dag gis gzhan gyi don ma lus pa rdzogs pa gzhan la phan pa yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @277a * // byin rlabs las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dag gis gzhan gyi don ma lus pa rdzogs pa gzhan la phan pa yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “beneficial to oneself and others” is that, due to the application of the perfection of one’s own aim, which is the characteristic of the abandonment of all obscurations together with their propensities, it is beneficial to oneself in every way, and due to the blessing of that, it is beneficial to others in every way, through the complete fulfillment of the aims of others by means of the enjoyment body and the emanation body, just as one wishes and just as one is fit.

original: yul dang dus so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa dngos po thams cad khyab par byed pa'o zhes pa khyab pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa dngos po thams cad khyab par byed pa'o zhes pa khyab pa'o //
translated: It is “pervading,” because it pervades all things, such as the minds of others, which are to be pervaded, because it is not restricted to a particular place or time.

original: las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rgyu dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir mtshan med do //
analyzed: las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rgyu dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir mtshan med do //
translated: It is “signless,” because it is free from the causes of the seal of karma, the seal of wisdom, and so on.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbyibs dang rnam par rtog pa gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa spangs pa'i phyir rnam rtog dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbyibs dang rnam par rtog pa gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa spangs pa'i phyir rnam rtog dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from conceptualization because it abandons the two pairs of the shapes of the apprehended and the apprehender and of the conceptualizations.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu'i gzugs la gcig pu gnyis med pa ste 'dir gnyis pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rnam rtog dang bral ba gcig pu'i sku'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu'i gzugs la gcig pu gnyis med pa ste 'dir gnyis pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rnam rtog dang bral ba gcig pu'i sku'o //
translated: It is the single body of the one free from conceptualization, because it is the form of the one ultimate truth, and because here there is no second, the conventional truth.

original: 'phags pa padma dkar po'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa padma dkar po'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The noble one, Padmankitar also says:

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa'i //
translated: The body endowed with the best of all aspects

original: sku ni mos pa sna tshogs las //
analyzed: sku ni mos pa sna tshogs las //
translated: arises from various aspirations.

original: rang rang bsam pas sems can gyi //
analyzed: rang rang bsam pas sems can gyi //
translated: The vision of sentient beings

original: mthong ba sprul pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba sprul pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is the characteristic of the emanation body.

original: gang zhig sems can kun gyi sgras //
analyzed: gang zhig sems can kun gyi sgras //
translated: The one who is manifested by the sounds of all sentient beings

original: rdzu 'phrul bdag nyid rab gsal byed //🔽sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis 'di //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bdag nyid rab gsal byed // sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis 'di //
translated: is the clear manifestation of the magical body.🔽This is the characteristic of the enjoyment body,

original: longs spyod rdzogs sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: which arises from the power of the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: mi rtag pa min rtag pa'ang min //
analyzed: mi rtag pa min rtag pa'ang min //
translated: It is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: gcig min du ma'i mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: gcig min du ma'i mtshan nyid min //
translated: It is not one, nor does it have the character of many.

original: dngos min dngos po med pa'ang min //
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med pa'ang min //
translated: It is not a thing, nor is it a non-thing.

original: gang 'di rten bral chos sku'o //
analyzed: gang 'di rten bral chos sku'o //
translated: This is the dharmakāya, free from a basis.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med cing //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med cing //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable,

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
translated: and attachment and non-attachment are completely abandoned.

original: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min //
translated: It is neither wisdom nor method.

original: 'di ni ngo bo nyid sku gzhan //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo nyid sku gzhan //
translated: This is the svabhāvikakāya.

original: zhes pa'o // rang gi lta ba'i 'dod pa mdor bstan par yang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rang gi lta ba'i 'dod pa mdor bstan par yang /
translated: In the brief presentation of his own philosophical position,🔽the Tantra of the Great and Perfect Dynamic Energy of the Lion states:

original: gzugs kyi phung po mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po mtha' yas pa //
translated: The infinite aggregate of form

original: bdag gi sprul sku mchog yin te //
analyzed: bdag gi sprul sku mchog yin te //
translated: is my supreme nirmāṇakāya.

original: sgra yi phung po mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: sgra yi phung po mtha' yas pa //
translated: The infinite aggregate of sound🔽is my supreme sambhogakāya.

original: bdag gi longs spyod rdzogs sku mchog / chos kyi phung po mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod rdzogs sku mchog / chos kyi phung po mtha' yas pa //
translated: The infinite aggregate of phenomena

original: bdag gi chos skur rab tu grags //
analyzed: bdag gi chos skur rab tu grags //
translated: is renowned as my dharmakāya.

original: bde ba'i phung po mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: bde ba'i phung po mtha' yas pa //
translated: The infinite aggregate of bliss🔽is my supreme, unchanging, blissful kāya.

original: bdag gi bde sku 'gyur med mchog / bsdus pa phung po de bzhin sku //
analyzed: bdag gi bde sku 'gyur med mchog / bsdus pa phung po de bzhin sku //
translated: The aggregates are summarized as kāyas,

original: yang dag bsags par yongs su grags //
analyzed: yang dag bsags par yongs su grags //
translated: and they are renowned as the perfect accumulation.

original: zhes pa'o // mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan la sogs pa rnams su yang rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dag las tha dad pa nyid kyis chos kyi sku rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan la sogs pa rnams su yang rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dag las tha dad pa nyid kyis chos kyi sku rnam par gzhag go //
translated: And in the Abhisamayālaṅkāra and so forth, the Dharma Body is established as being different from the Nature Body and the Enjoyment Body.

original: @277b rang bzhin brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: @277b rang bzhin brjod par bya ste /
translated: The Nature Body should be stated.

original: dang po nye bar bstan pa thob pa'i rjes su mthun par las kyi phyag rgya'i snyoms 'jug gis rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po zad pa las 'gyur ba'i bde ba chung ngu'i chung ngu 'phel lo //
analyzed: dang po nye bar bstan pa thob pa'i rjes su mthun par las kyi phyag rgya'i snyoms 'jug gis rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po zad pa las 'gyur ba'i bde ba chung ngu'i chung ngu 'phel lo //
translated: First, after attaining the teaching, the great of the great discriminations are exhausted by the meditative concentration of the karmamudra, which is in accordance with the attainment, and the small of the small bliss of transformation increases.

original: de bzhin du sna tshogs yum la sogs pa'i lha mo ye shes phyag rgya'i dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa chen po zad pa las 'gyur ba'i bde ba chung ngu 'phel lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna tshogs yum la sogs pa'i lha mo ye shes phyag rgya'i dmigs pas rnam par rtog pa chen po zad pa las 'gyur ba'i bde ba chung ngu 'phel lo //
translated: Likewise, by the objective of the jñānamudrā goddesses such as Viśvamātā, the great of the great discriminations are exhausted, and the small of the small bliss of transformation increases.

original: dpal ldan rgyud du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal ldan rgyud du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also stated in the Śrīguhyatantra:

original: rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel ba'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bsten par bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel ba'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bsten par bya //
translated: In order to increase this connate bliss of the Victor, first rely on the karmamudrā.

original: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni gdong dang lag pa rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni gdong dang lag pa rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
translated: Then, the form of the sun is the face, hands, feet, and all the limbs complete.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: dang po'i sgra las phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs snga ma du ba la sogs pa'i gzugs chos kyi phyag rgya'i dmigs pas nyon mongs pa chung ngu zad pa las mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po 'phel lo ;
analyzed: dang po'i sgra las phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs snga ma du ba la sogs pa'i gzugs chos kyi phyag rgya'i dmigs pas nyon mongs pa chung ngu zad pa las mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po 'phel lo ;
translated: From the word “first,” the form of the great seal is the form of smoke and so on, the object of observation of the doctrine seal, from the exhaustion of the small afflictions, the unchanging great bliss increases.

original: / gzugs phyi ma sna tshogs gzugs zhes bya ba phyag rgya chen mo goms pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa chung ngu'i chung ngu zad pa las mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i chen po 'phel lo //
analyzed: / gzugs phyi ma sna tshogs gzugs zhes bya ba phyag rgya chen mo goms pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa chung ngu'i chung ngu zad pa las mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i chen po 'phel lo //
translated: The later form, called “the variety of forms,” is the great great seal, from the exhaustion of the small of the small obstructions to omniscience together with the imprints, the great of the great unchanging great bliss increases.

original: 'phel ba zad pa spangs pa ma yin nam mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'phel ba zad pa spangs pa ma yin nam mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is not increase the abandonment of exhaustion? How does the unchanging bliss increase?”

original: gsungs pa / 'phel ba'i 'phel bar 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'phel ba'i 'phel bar 'gyur ba med //
translated: It is said, “The increase of increase is not an increase.”

original: ces pa'o // rim gyis 'byung ba'i don rnams gser dang nam mkha' dag pa bzhin du sgrib pa spangs pa ni 'phel ba ste /
analyzed: ces pa'o // rim gyis 'byung ba'i don rnams gser dang nam mkha' dag pa bzhin du sgrib pa spangs pa ni 'phel ba ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of “arising in sequence” is that the abandonment of obscurations is like the purification of gold and space.

original: brjod pa'i 'phel ba'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dri ma med pa zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid 'phel bar 'gyur ba de yang med do //
analyzed: brjod pa'i 'phel ba'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dri ma med pa zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid 'phel bar 'gyur ba de yang med do //
translated: The abandonment of all obscurations along with the habitual tendencies of verbal proliferation is called “stainless.” The increase of that which is the nature of the stage of perfection does not exist.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis 'byung ba'i sgrib pa nye bar bsags pas slar yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis 'byung ba'i sgrib pa nye bar bsags pas slar yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the obscurations that arise in sequence are accumulated and then again diminished.

original: de'i phyir nyams pa de'i nyams pa nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de yang med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams pa de'i nyams pa nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de yang med de /
translated: Therefore, the imputation of that diminution as a diminution does not exist.

original: rtag par brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be permanent.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang 'phel ba dang zad pa dag med pa'i phyir ci ltar lam la sogs pa 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang 'phel ba dang zad pa dag med pa'i phyir ci ltar lam la sogs pa 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, since there is no increase or decrease, how is it that the path and so on are not fruitless?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams kyi //
translated: The phenomena that lack intrinsic reality

original: zhes pa'o // chos gang zhig 'phel ba la @278a * //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // chos gang zhig 'phel ba la @278a * //
translated: Thus, whatever things increase, etc.,

original: sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa de rnams ni rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa de rnams ni rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: are devoid of intrinsic reality. Those are things devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jigs pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na ma yin pa sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jigs pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na ma yin pa sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever their arising and cessation, they are also not that, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin no'i sgra las nub pa dang 'char ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'jig rten kun rdzob sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin no'i sgra las nub pa dang 'char ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'jig rten kun rdzob sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The word “thus” indicates that the characteristics of setting, rising, etc., are also like an illusion in the conventional world.

original: de gsungs pa /🔽'byung rnams 'jigs par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de gsungs pa / 'byung rnams 'jigs par mi 'gyur te //
translated: He states:🔽The elements do not perish,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis skye mi 'gyur //
translated: because they do not arise by intrinsic reality.

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: sna tshogs 'di ni rang bzhin med //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di ni rang bzhin med //
translated: this diversity is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po dngos med mtshan nyid gcig / ces pa kun rdzob tu don bya ba byed pa'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mtshan nyid gcig / ces pa kun rdzob tu don bya ba byed pa'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Things and nonthings have the same characteristic, because they perform their function conventionally.

original: de kho na rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since they are empty of intrinsic reality, they have the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: 'gyur ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: The meditation on change, movement, and so on, is taught.

original: rang gi shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One's wisdom, etc.

original: gang gi tshe las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa rang gi shes rab la 'khyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje nor bu'i padmar son pa de'i tshe rdo rje nor bu der son pa'i zla ba las kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs so
analyzed: gang gi tshe las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa rang gi shes rab la 'khyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje nor bu'i padmar son pa de'i tshe rdo rje nor bu der son pa'i zla ba las kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs so
translated: When the bodhicitta, which is the vajra of the mind, reaches the lotus of the karmamudra's jewel, at that time the bliss of the karmamudra in that vajra jewel is the state of change.

original: // ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni g-yo ba'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: // ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni g-yo ba'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The bliss of the jnanamudra is the state of movement.

original: g-yo ba zhes pa dngos po ste de'i chos las 'gyur ba yang yang dag par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes pa dngos po ste de'i chos las 'gyur ba yang yang dag par bzung ba'o //
translated: The word movement is a thing, and its attribute is change, which is correctly apprehended.

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs 'di dag mngon sum du byas pa'i 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dbang phyug gi mtshan nyid 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs 'di dag mngon sum du byas pa'i 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dbang phyug gi mtshan nyid 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
translated: These states of bliss are the accomplishment of the worldly siddhi, which is characterized by the lordship of the desire and form realms, which are made manifest.

original: phyag rgya chen po mi g-yo ba dang mi 'gyur ba bsgom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mi g-yo ba dang mi 'gyur ba bsgom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the unchanging and unmoving mahāmudrā is the accomplishment of the supramundane feat, the characteristic of omniscience.

original: lus ngag sems kyi rtsa rnams su //
analyzed: lus ngag sems kyi rtsa rnams su //
translated: In the nāḍīs of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la dbu ma nyid dga' ba bzhi la srog rtsol gyi stobs kyi khu ba thig les khyab pa'i cha bzhi lus la sogs pa'i rtsa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la dbu ma nyid dga' ba bzhi la srog rtsol gyi stobs kyi khu ba thig les khyab pa'i cha bzhi lus la sogs pa'i rtsa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and so on. In the central nāḍī, the four joys are pervaded by the four parts of the bindu of bodhicitta by the power of prāṇāyāma.

original: de nas dpral bar sku bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dpral bar sku bsgom pa'o //
translated: Then, the body is meditated on in the forehead.

original: snying gar gsung bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar gsung bsgom pa'o //
translated: Speech is meditated on in the heart.

original: gsang bar thugs bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gsang bar thugs bsgom pa'o //
translated: The mind is meditated on in the secret place.

original: sku la sogs pa'i thig le rnams legs par bsdus pa gcig pa nyid kyang rdo rje nor bur ye shes pa bsgom pa ste tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag mdor bstan pa'o /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i thig le rnams legs par bsdus pa gcig pa nyid kyang rdo rje nor bur ye shes pa bsgom pa ste tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag mdor bstan pa'o /
translated: The single bindu of the body, and so on, is also the meditation on the gnosis in the vajra jewel. Those two verses are the concise explanation of the branch of samādhi.

original: // / thig le bzhi @278b po rnams kyi bcing ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / thig le bzhi @278b po rnams kyi bcing ba gsungs pa /
translated: The binding of the four bindus is explained.

original: shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Wisdom” and so forth.

original: shes rab chags pas zhu ba'i ni gtum mo 'bar bas zhu ba'i thig le rnams brjod pa'i rim pas mgo bo dpral ba'i padma las rdzogs pa'i gnas nor bu'i padma ste der zhugs pa nor bu'i padmar son pa rnams 'ching ba dam pa'i shes rab ces pa la
analyzed: shes rab chags pas zhu ba'i ni gtum mo 'bar bas zhu ba'i thig le rnams brjod pa'i rim pas mgo bo dpral ba'i padma las rdzogs pa'i gnas nor bu'i padma ste der zhugs pa nor bu'i padmar son pa rnams 'ching ba dam pa'i shes rab ces pa la
translated: The “melted” by the passion of wisdom are the drops melted by the blazing caṇḍālī. By the process of expression, they enter the head, the lotus of the forehead, and the place of completion, the jewel lotus. Having entered there, they reach the jewel lotus. “ Binding” and so forth.🔽“ Wisdom” and so forth.

original: sogs pa'o zhes pa srog bcings pa mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ji srid par ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'o zhes pa srog bcings pa mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas kho na bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ji srid par ro //
translated: “ One should meditate” on the binding of the life-force, that is, on the unchanging bliss, “for as long as” the process of expression.

original: brjod pa'i rim pas mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba 'phel ba dang zad pa la sogs pa de kho na ma yin par rtogs pa de nyid 'jig rten pa'i dpes ston pa ;🔽ji ltar zla shar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pas mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba 'phel ba dang zad pa la sogs pa de kho na ma yin par rtogs pa de nyid 'jig rten pa'i dpes ston pa ; ji ltar zla shar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the process of expression, the increase and decrease of unchanging bliss and so forth are not the real thing. That is taught by an example from the world.🔽“ Just as the moon” and so forth.

original: ji ltar zla shar rim pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar zla shar rim pa yis //
translated: Just as the moon

original: cha rnams kyis ni rdzogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: cha rnams kyis ni rdzogs par 'gyur //
translated: is completed by the parts that arise in sequence,🔽the bodhicitta🔽is completed by the drops.

original: 'jig rten pa'i zla ba rdzogs pa ni grib ma nyams pa nyid 'ba' zhig rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i zla ba rdzogs pa ni grib ma nyams pa nyid 'ba' zhig rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The completion of the worldly moon is the completion of just the decrease of the shadow.

original: de chad pa'am rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de chad pa'am rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is cut off or completed.

original: de ni rtag tu rdzogs pa'i yin yang mun pas bkab pa dang ma bkab pa dag las nyams pa dang rdzogs pa'i tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu rdzogs pa'i yin yang mun pas bkab pa dang ma bkab pa dag las nyams pa dang rdzogs pa'i tha snyad byed do //
translated: Although it is always complete, it is said to be diminished or complete in relation to being covered or not covered by darkness.

original: de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyang rdo rje nor bur shar ba rim pas rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams kyi steng du gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyang rdo rje nor bur shar ba rim pas rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams kyi steng du gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, unchanging gnosis, which arises in the vajra jewel, is the completion of the cakra of the crown, above the grounds of Very Joyful and so on, which are divided into the causal and so on, as will be explained.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs zhes pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa nyams pa spangs pa nyid rdzogs pa'i sgras bstan pa yin gyi ye shes chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs zhes pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa nyams pa spangs pa nyid rdzogs pa'i sgras bstan pa yin gyi ye shes chad pa ma yin la /
translated: The term complete indicates the abandonment of the diminution of the afflictive obscurations and so on, which are the afflictive, the knowledge, and the meditative stabilization obscurations together with their imprints, but it does not indicate that gnosis is cut off.

original: de rdzogs pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: de rdzogs pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: It is also not that it is completed.

original: / de lung du gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de lung du gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the scriptures:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtag tu shar //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtag tu shar //
translated: It always arises in the buddhas.

original: ma rig gdug sems can gyis min //
analyzed: ma rig gdug sems can gyis min //
translated: Not by the evil mind of ignorance.

original: zhes pa'o // sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: The venerable Saraha also says:

original: byed pa dang bral 'gro la rtag tu shar //
analyzed: byed pa dang bral 'gro la rtag tu shar //
translated: Always shining for the world, free of action,

original: gang zhig dus su nges par gsungs pa na //
analyzed: gang zhig dus su nges par gsungs pa na //
translated: When it is spoken of at the right time,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'ang tshig gis dbul 'gyur ba //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'ang tshig gis dbul 'gyur ba //
translated: Even the Omniscient One is at a loss for words.

original: bde ba'i rgyal po gcig pu rgyal gyur cig / ces pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyal po gcig pu rgyal gyur cig / ces pa'o //
translated: May the King of Happiness be victorious alone!

original: rdzogs pa'i dpe gsungs nas chad pa'i dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dpe gsungs nas chad pa'i dpe gsungs pa /
translated: Having spoken the example of completion, he speaks the example of cessation:

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽ji ltar sa bon du gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su son pa mtshan mar gyur pa'i ri bong rim par @279a * //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o // ji ltar sa bon du gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su son pa mtshan mar gyur pa'i ri bong rim par @279a * //
translated: Just as, etc.

original: 'phel bas rdzogs par ri bong can mi gnas rdzogs pa mi rtag go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'phel bas rdzogs par ri bong can mi gnas rdzogs pa mi rtag go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Just as the sign of the moon, which is the seed, having reached the middle of the moon-disk, by the gradual increase of the sign of the rabbit, the moon is completed. The rabbit does not remain in completion. The meaning is: impermanent.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i bag chags 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid rim par 'phel bas sems kyang 'gyur med bde bar mi gnas te chags pa dang bral ba skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir gnyis med pa ni 'gyur med bde ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i bag chags 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid rim par 'phel bas sems kyang 'gyur med bde bar mi gnas te chags pa dang bral ba skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir gnyis med pa ni 'gyur med bde ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the mind does not abide in unchanging bliss, because of the increase of the characteristics of the bliss of the transformation of the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence, and because of the arising and cessation of the mind, which is free from attachment.

original: phyi nang sbyar ba'i zol gyis dpe bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyi nang sbyar ba'i zol gyis dpe bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The example is taught by the pretense of an external and internal application.

original: skyed dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyed dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The generation and so forth.

original: ji ltar zla ba'i tshes gcig la sogs pa'i cha rnams rim pas skyed pa dkar po'i phyogs dang cha rnams rim pas nyams pa nag po'i phyogs te de dag rab tu gnas pa ni 'jig rten pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba'i tshes gcig la sogs pa'i cha rnams rim pas skyed pa dkar po'i phyogs dang cha rnams rim pas nyams pa nag po'i phyogs te de dag rab tu gnas pa ni 'jig rten pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the parts of the moon, the first day of the lunar month and so forth, are generated in sequence, and the parts of the moon, the fifteenth day of the lunar month and so forth, are diminished in sequence, and their abiding is understood by the world.

original: de dag gi dbus su son pa cha bcu drug pa ni skad cig gcig 'byung ba ji lta ba de bzhin du khu ba'i thig le'i'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbus su son pa cha bcu drug pa ni skad cig gcig 'byung ba ji lta ba de bzhin du khu ba'i thig le'i'o //
translated: Just as the sixteenth day of the lunar month, which is in the middle of those, arises in a single moment, in the same way, the drop of semen.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems nor bur rdzogs pa la ni skad cig gcig mi 'gyur bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems nor bur rdzogs pa la ni skad cig gcig mi 'gyur bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa /
translated: When the yogin is perfected in the jewel of the enlightenment spirit, he is manifestly and perfectly enlightened in an instant without change.

original: de g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe sems kyi rdo rje rdo rje nor bur mi g-yo bas de ni skad cig thams cad rdzogs zhes pa 'byung ba dang 'jug pa nyi khri brgyad gnyis brgya'i skad cig rnams kyis rdzogs pa rnam par ma chad par 'bab pa'o
analyzed: de g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe sems kyi rdo rje rdo rje nor bur mi g-yo bas de ni skad cig thams cad rdzogs zhes pa 'byung ba dang 'jug pa nyi khri brgyad gnyis brgya'i skad cig rnams kyis rdzogs pa rnam par ma chad par 'bab pa'o
translated: When he is unmoving, at that time the vajra of mind is unmoving in the jewel of the vajra, and that is the perfection of all instants.

original: // don dam pa'i bsnyen par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: // don dam pa'i bsnyen par yang gsungs pa /
translated: The ultimate approximation is also stated:

original: nyin mtshan bsam gtan dbang gis rim pa yis //
analyzed: nyin mtshan bsam gtan dbang gis rim pa yis //
translated: By the power of meditative concentration day and night,

original: gang tshe sems ni dbu ma'i rtsar gnas pa //
analyzed: gang tshe sems ni dbu ma'i rtsar gnas pa //
translated: when the mind abides in the central channel,

original: shin tu rnam dag gnyis med mtha' yas sku //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag gnyis med mtha' yas sku //
translated: the utterly pure, nondual, infinite body,

original: rdo rje rtse gcig pa de la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse gcig pa de la phyag 'tshal //
translated: the single-pointed vajra, I pay homage to that.

original: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du sems kyi rdo rje 'di dkar po'i phyogs chags pa la mi gnas shing dkar min phyogs chags bral la yang mi 'gro ste chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i mtha' spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du sems kyi rdo rje 'di dkar po'i phyogs chags pa la mi gnas shing dkar min phyogs chags bral la yang mi 'gro ste chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba'i mtha' spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, this mind-vajra does not abide in attachment to the side of virtue, nor does it go to the side of non-virtue, free from attachment, because it abandons the extremes of attachment and non-attachment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: phyogs gnyis po yi dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis po yi dbus gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the middle between the two sides,

original: rdzogs pa la gnas gnyis su med ni rab tu gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa la gnas gnyis su med ni rab tu gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Abiding in perfection, it does not abide in the non-dual.

original: de mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de mtshan yang dag par brjod par gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated in the Tantra of the Wheel of Time:

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: Enlightened in a single instant,

original: skad cig thams cad rnam bsgom pa //
analyzed: skad cig thams cad rnam bsgom pa //
translated: Meditating on all instants,

original: cha med cha las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: cha med cha las 'das pa ste //
translated: Partless and beyond parts,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang //
translated: Bearing the peak of the fourth concentration.

original: zhes pa'o // kye'i rdo rjer yang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // kye'i rdo rjer yang /
translated: And in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: de la thog ma dbus mtha' med //
analyzed: de la thog ma dbus mtha' med //
translated: It has no beginning, middle, or end,

original: @279b srid med mya ngan 'das pa med //
analyzed: @279b srid med mya ngan 'das pa med //
translated: No existence and no transcendence of it.

original: 'di ni mchog tu bde chen nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu bde chen nyid //
translated: This is the supreme great bliss,

original: bdag med gzhan yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med gzhan yang med pa'o //
translated: With no self and no other.

original: zhes pa'o // 'khor ba pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'khor ba pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: The stages of the transmigrator are stated:🔽Since the sixteen parts of the bindu that is the seed are complete in the vajra jewel,

original: de'i zhes pa sa bon du gyur pa'i thig le'i cha bcu drug po rnams rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje nor bur rdzogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i zhes pa sa bon du gyur pa'i thig le'i cha bcu drug po rnams rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje nor bur rdzogs pa ste ;
translated: they are complete.🔽However, since there is no method, they are lost through the practice of separation from passion, that is, the loss of passion.

original: 'on kyang thabs med pas de chags bral las te chags pa nyams pa'i sbyor ba las cha nyams pa cha bco lnga po rnams nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs med pas de chags bral las te chags pa nyams pa'i sbyor ba las cha nyams pa cha bco lnga po rnams nyams pa'o //
translated: The fifteen parts are lost.

original: rdo rje nas brtsams te nyams pa la nyi ma rdul gyi gzugs kyis gtsug tor du rab tu rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje nas brtsams te nyams pa la nyi ma rdul gyi gzugs kyis gtsug tor du rab tu rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: Beginning from the vajra, the loss is the complete perfection in the uṣṇīṣa of the form of the sun’s particle.

original: slar yang ste yang dang yang du las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gtsug tor du shar ba /
analyzed: slar yang ste yang dang yang du las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gtsug tor du shar ba /
translated: Again, through the yoga of the karma consort, and so on, the sun rises in the uṣṇīṣa.

original: slar yang rdo rje nor bur rdzogs //
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje nor bur rdzogs //
translated: Again, it is complete in the vajra jewel.

original: de chags bral las chags nyams pa //
analyzed: de chags bral las chags nyams pa //
translated: That is lost through separation from passion, the loss of passion.

original: lus can ye shes nyams pa min //
analyzed: lus can ye shes nyams pa min //
translated: The body is not lost, nor is the gnosis.

original: ye shes ni cha bcu drug pa ste de nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni cha bcu drug pa ste de nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: The gnosis is the sixteen parts; it is not lost.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi snying po can zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi snying po can zhes pa ste /
translated: All sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata's gnosis.

original: ci ste yang ye shes nyams pas 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang ye shes nyams pas 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if gnosis were to decline, then they would die.

original: rdzogs pa'i sgra'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sgra'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the word perfect is stated:

original: 'di'i bde ba'i che zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bde ba'i che zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of his bliss is perfect.

original: 'di'i zhes pa byang chub kyi sems kyi bde ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid rdzogs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes pa byang chub kyi sems kyi bde ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid rdzogs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: His refers to the nature of the bliss of bodhicitta, which is called perfect.

original: 'di nyid rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bya ba'o //
translated: This is what the yogis do.

original: bde ba chen po bsten pa'i rgyu rnam par spangs pa dngos po bar ma gzhan ni lus can rnams kyi bde ba chen po de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba dang sdud pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bde ba chen po bsten pa'i rgyu rnam par spangs pa dngos po bar ma gzhan ni lus can rnams kyi bde ba chen po de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba dang sdud pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the experience of great bliss is the cause of the arising and dissolution of the great bliss of embodied beings, which is a different, intermediate entity, devoid of the cause of abandonment.

original: rdzogs pa la brtan par byas pa ma yin pa'i bde ba thig le 'di ni yang dang yang du skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa la brtan par byas pa ma yin pa'i bde ba thig le 'di ni yang dang yang du skye ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bliss of the bindu, which is not stabilized in perfection, arises and dissolves again and again.

original: 'dir dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir dpe gsungs pa /
translated: Here, an example is stated:

original: rang phyogs dag las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang phyogs dag las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From one's own side, etc.

original: ji ltar dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs dag las zla ba dang byang dang lhor bgrod pa dag las nyi ma bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs dag las zla ba dang byang dang lhor bgrod pa dag las nyi ma bzhin te /
translated: Just as the moon and the sun move north and south from the white and black directions,

original: nyin mo 'phel ba dang zad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyin mo 'phel ba dang zad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //

original: chags bral las gzhan sdig pa med //
analyzed: chags bral las gzhan sdig pa med //
translated: There is no sin other than the loss of passion.

original: ces pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa la /

analyzed: 'dod chags nyams las sdig ste gang phyir shin tu sdug ma la ni zhe sdang skye //

analyzed: sdang bas gti mug 'di las rang gi rdo rje lhung las sems ni rtag rmongs te //

original: 'dod chags nyams las sdig pa ni snying rje zad pa'i bdag nyid las so //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyams las sdig pa ni snying rje zad pa'i bdag nyid las so //

original: 'di nyid ci'i phyir zhe na gang phyir te gang gi phyir shin tu sdug pa la ni 'dod /
analyzed: 'di nyid ci'i phyir zhe na gang phyir te gang gi phyir shin tu sdug pa la ni 'dod /

original: ma la zhes dang mdza' ba nyams pa byams pa zad pa'i bdag nyid skye'o zhes so sor mngon bar @282a * //🔽sbrel bar bya'o //🔽sdang las gti mug ni yang dag par dga' ba nyams shing dga' ba zad pa'i bdag nyid do //

translated: The text should be read as the mother of hatred, and the mother of delusion, and so on, with the words the exhaustion of love supplied after each one.🔽Hatred is the mother of delusion, because it is the exhaustion of delight, which is the nature of delight.

original: rmongs pa ni bde ba nyams pa'i mtshan nyin btang snyoms zad pa'i bdag nyid do zhes pa ste tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni bde ba nyams pa'i mtshan nyin btang snyoms zad pa'i bdag nyid do zhes pa ste tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi med pa'i phyir ro //

original: sdig pa gang las bsod nams yin /🔽'dod chags 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid snying rje /
analyzed: sdig pa gang las bsod nams yin / 'dod chags 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid snying rje /

analyzed: zhe sdang nyams pa'i bdag nyid byams pa / gti mug zad pa'i bdag nyid dga' ba /

original: mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i bdag nyid btang snyoms zhes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i bdag nyid btang snyoms zhes pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: ci 'di yang yod ce na /

translated: in the Buddhakapala🔽the view is compassion,

analyzed: kun nas 'khyud pa byams pa ste //

analyzed: gnyis 'dus pa na 'gyur ba gang //
translated: Whatever occurs in the union of the two,

analyzed: de na bdag gis btang snyoms brjod //

analyzed: de ltar dngos po'i sbyor ldan pa //

analyzed: ci ltar 'dod chags kyis 'ching 'gyur //

original: zhes pa'o // gnas par bya zhes pa lam bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gnas par bya zhes pa lam bsgoms pas so //

translated: The moon arises from the transformation of the vowels such as a, and the sun arises from the transformation of the consonants such as ka. The union is the support. The left and right

translated: The vajra jewel is the place of consecration, which is not nirvana. The dust and the sun are the sole of the essence of the earth. One is the right foot, which is the sole of the element of wisdom.

original: rkang ma theb sen mo sngar 'dod pa'i cha 'char ba'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnyis pa ni g-yon pa gang yin pa'o zhes pa tshangs pa'i sgo nga'i rtse mo gnon no //
analyzed: rkang ma theb sen mo sngar 'dod pa'i cha 'char ba'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnyis pa ni g-yon pa gang yin pa'o zhes pa tshangs pa'i sgo nga'i rtse mo gnon no //
translated: The uṣṇīṣa is the semen, which is beyond the bliss of existence. The moon is the element of consciousness, which is the nature of the arising of the part of desire. The second is the left foot, which is the tip of the egg of Brahmā.

original: rtag tu ste dus gsum du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ma rig pa mi shes pa'i gri gug gis mi chod pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ste dus gsum du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ma rig pa mi shes pa'i gri gug gis mi chod pa'o //

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pas dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pas dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is indivisible by the divisions of subject and object, because it is beyond the reality of consciousness.

translated: It is the desire of the form of great bliss, and having performed its function, it abides on dry land as the gem.🔽It is the worship of the three worlds, because it has abandoned worldly conduct, and it abides in the uṣṇīṣa at the end of the far shore of saṃsāra.

analyzed: nyid sgrib pa med pa nyid las nya dang gnam stong la mngon par khyab pa dang ldan pa 'gro ba'i gtso bo gcig pu de'i zhabs stong pa nyid dang snying rje bco lnga'i bdag nyid zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin 'khor ba pa dang mya ngan las
translated: From the state of nonobstruction, the sole lord of migrating beings pervades the full moon and the full sun, which are the nature of the moon and sun, the nature of emptiness and compassion, the nature of the fifteen digits.🔽

original: 'das pa'i lam 'gog par byed pa'i zhabs gnyis dag la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i lam 'gog par byed pa'i zhabs gnyis dag la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes drug par ni /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes drug par ni /
translated: In the sixth verse of the supreme unchanging intuition,

analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i sgras mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i ye shes rdo rje sems dpa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du yid skyob par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir sngags kyang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes su brjod do //
translated: In the same way, because it protects the mind, the mantra is also called the supreme unchanging intuition.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud du yang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud du yang /
translated: In the Root Tantra it is said:

original: lus ngag sems kyi khams rnams ni //
analyzed: lus ngag sems kyi khams rnams ni //
translated: The elements of body, speech, and mind

original: gang phyir skyob par gyur de'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skyob par gyur de'i phyir //
translated: are protected, and therefore

original: sngags don sngags kyi sgra yis ni //
analyzed: sngags don sngags kyi sgra yis ni //
translated: the meaning of the mantra, the sound of the mantra,

original: stong nyid ye shes 'gyur med de //
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes 'gyur med de //
translated: The unchanging wisdom of emptiness

original: bsod nams ye shes las byung sngags //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes las byung sngags //
translated: is the mantra arisen from merit and wisdom,

original: stong nyid snying rje'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje'i bdag nyid can //
translated: the nature of emptiness and compassion.

original: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du gzhan nang gi rig pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba phyag rgya chen mo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i gzugs can ma chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa rdzogs @284a * //🔽pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du gzhan nang gi rig pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba phyag rgya chen mo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i gzugs can ma chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa rdzogs @284a * // pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Similarly, the other inner knowledge, the great seal, the nature of the perfection of wisdom, the form of innate joy, the natural outflow of the dharmadhatu, is the perfected state.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas kyi yul rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa mchog gi dbang po'i spyod yul mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa me long gi
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas kyi yul rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa mchog gi dbang po'i spyod yul mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa me long gi
translated: Vajrasattva and the object of the buddhas are not the domain of the sense faculties of dependent origination, but the domain of the supreme sense faculties, the nature of supreme unchanging bliss, beyond the dharmata of subtle particles, the mirror-like wisdom.

original: pra phab pa dang rmi lam dang mtshungs pa de dag ni rgyal ba rnams kyis lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes gsungs te mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pra phab pa dang rmi lam dang mtshungs pa de dag ni rgyal ba rnams kyis lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes gsungs te mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: Those are said by the Victorious Ones to be the co-emergent body, because of their nature of supreme changelessness.

original: 'dir 'gyur med rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med lnga ste stong pa chen por gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur med rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med lnga ste stong pa chen por gsungs so //
translated: Here, the changeless ones are the unobstructed forms, feelings, discriminations, composites, and consciousnesses. Those are the five changeless ones, taught in the Great Emptiness.

original: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med sngar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med sngar gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, the unobstructed elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space were previously taught to be changeless.

original: 'gyur med drug ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid sgrib pa med pa rnams te so sor rang gi yul 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gyur med drug ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid sgrib pa med pa rnams te so sor rang gi yul 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa rnams so //
translated: The six changeless ones are the unobstructed eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, which are free from apprehending their individual objects.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi khams sgrib pa med pa rnams kyang 'gyur med drug tu gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi khams sgrib pa med pa rnams kyang 'gyur med drug tu gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, the unobstructed elements of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects are said to be the six immutable ones.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di rnams gcig tu ro mnyam par gyur pa ni thig le stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di rnams gcig tu ro mnyam par gyur pa ni thig le stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: These aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which have become of one taste, are the empty bindu.

original: thig le de yang mi 'pho bar gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur bde bar brjod do //
analyzed: thig le de yang mi 'pho bar gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur bde bar brjod do //

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba yang aa yig ste /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba yang aa yig ste /
translated: The supreme immutable is the letter A.

original: aa yig las byung ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' ma ning gi go 'phang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes brjod de shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i
analyzed: aa yig las byung ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' ma ning gi go 'phang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes brjod de shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i
translated: That which arises from the letter A is the perfect buddha, the nature of wisdom and method, Vajrasattva, the stage of the neutral, the body of innate joy, because it is the nature of the knower and the known, inseparable cause and effect.

original: phyir ro // de yang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: phyir ro // de yang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: And that is the Bhagavān Kālacakra, the stage of supreme immutable bliss.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod par yang gsungs pa /
translated: The Thorough Clarification of the Noble Intention also says:

analyzed: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //

analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces pa'o //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces pa'o //
translated: are the six syllables of the empty drop.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud du yang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud du yang /
translated: The Root Tantra also says:

original: aa yig ming gis rab brjod pa //
analyzed: aa yig ming gis rab brjod pa //
translated: The one called by the name “a”

original: chos kyi dbyings ni 'gyur med che //🔽rgyal dbang rnams kyi rdo rje yis //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni 'gyur med che // rgyal dbang rnams kyi rdo rje yis //
translated: is the unchanging great realm of reality.🔽The cause of the birth, body, speech, and mind

original: skye gnas sku gsung thugs kyi rgyu //
analyzed: skye gnas sku gsung thugs kyi rgyu //
translated: of the lords of the victors is the vajra.

analyzed: @284b 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa yig byung //

analyzed: aa yig yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen mchog tu mi 'gyur ba //
translated: the great meaning, the supreme unchanging,

original: srog chen po ste skye ba med //
analyzed: srog chen po ste skye ba med //
translated: the great life, the unborn.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is free from verbal expression,🔽the supreme cause of all expressions,

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //🔽dbyer med chos can sku gsung thugs //
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed // dbyer med chos can sku gsung thugs //

analyzed: rdo rje gsung rnams skyed byed pa //
translated: It is the vajra speech that generates🔽the indivisible body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyal ba'i sku rnams kyi gang de //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sku rnams kyi gang de //
