original: rdo rje'i skye gnas rab tu brjod //🔽gang phyir sangs rgyas chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skye gnas rab tu brjod // gang phyir sangs rgyas chos rnams kyi //
translated: It is called the “womb of the vajra.”🔽Because it is the source of🔽mastery and so forth,

original: dbang phyug la sogs kun 'byung ba //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs kun 'byung ba //
translated: and of all the qualities of the Buddha,

original: chos kun 'byung bar brjod pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: chos kun 'byung bar brjod pa'i phyir ;
translated: it is said to be the source of all phenomena.

original: / bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin mchog / ces pa'o //
analyzed: / bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin mchog / ces pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme nature of merit and wisdom.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is a brief presentation of the branches of meditative concentration.

original: da ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the nature of the relative cause and effect is taught:

original: stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “From emptiness arises the image,

original: stong pa nam mkha' las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan rnam pa thams cad pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu ste byed pa dang khu ba mi 'gyur ba las skyes bde ba 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa nam mkha' las byung ba'i gzugs brnyan rnam pa thams cad pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu ste byed pa dang khu ba mi 'gyur ba las skyes bde ba 'bras bu'o //
translated: the cause is the image arisen from emptiness, the sky, having the characteristics of all aspects. The result is the bliss arisen from the unchanging seminal essence and blood.

original: rgyu yang 'bras bu zag pa med pa'i bde bas rgyas btab pa bde ba'i gzugs su byas pa ste bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'bras bu zag pa med pa'i bde bas rgyas btab pa bde ba'i gzugs su byas pa ste bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The cause is also sealed by the result, the uncontaminated bliss, and is made into the form of bliss, because it is the nature of bliss.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba de yang de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyus rgyas btab pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba de yang de lta bur gyur pa'i rgyus rgyas btab pa ste /
translated: That uncontaminated bliss is also sealed by that kind of cause,

original: dmigs pa med pa stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of emptiness, which is without an objective support.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /🔽stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa / stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness and compassion is stated:🔽“Emptiness is the cause, compassion is the result.”

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa'i sems ni rgyus te dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje 'gyur med 'dzin pa 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid gzugs brnyan 'dzin pa'i sems ni rgyus te dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje 'gyur med 'dzin pa 'bras bu'o //
translated: Emptiness with an objective support, the mind that apprehends a reflection, is the cause; compassion without an objective support, the apprehension of immutability, is the result.

original: stong nyid snying rje 'di dag dbyer med pa nyid gcig pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub sems gang yin pa de mi 'pho ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje 'di dag dbyer med pa nyid gcig pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub sems gang yin pa de mi 'pho ba zhes brjod de /
translated: That bodhicitta, which is the characteristic of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, is called “unmoving,”

original: gzhan las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya las skyes pa 'gyur ba dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya las skyes pa 'gyur ba dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is not born from another, or from an action seal or wisdom seal, and is not characterized by change or movement.

original: de yang chad pa dang 'khor ba dang bral bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang chad pa dang 'khor ba dang bral bar gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be free from nihilism and saṃsāra:🔽“The emptiness that is the cause is the emptiness of the body of the yogin.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nirvana and so forth.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i gzugs dang / 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa'i mi 'gyur ba zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po ste @285a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i gzugs dang / 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa'i mi 'gyur ba zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen po ste @285a * //
translated: The form that is free from the nature of emptiness of nirvana and the unchanging, uncontaminated great bliss that transcends the characteristics of the bliss that arises in samsara

original: gzugs dang mi 'gyur ba de dag sbyor pa gnyis med mchog phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang mi 'gyur ba de dag sbyor pa gnyis med mchog phul du byung ba'o //
translated: are the supreme, unsurpassed union of form and unchanging bliss.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rtag dang chad las nges par grol //
analyzed: rtag dang chad las nges par grol //
translated: Liberated from permanence and annihilation.

original: zhes pa'o // 'dir tha dad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'dir tha dad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the difference is stated:

original: dngos med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nonexistent and so forth.

original: gzugs rnam pa thams cad pa'i rang gi sems kyi snang ba ni dngos med pa chad min te /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa thams cad pa'i rang gi sems kyi snang ba ni dngos med pa chad min te /
translated: The appearances of one's own mind in all aspects of form are not nonexistent annihilation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos med las byung mtshan nyid phyir te dngos med stong pa nyid nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i mthil nyid 'ba' zhig las dus gsum dang khams gsum pa rab tu gsal ba so so rang gis rig pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos med las byung mtshan nyid phyir te dngos med stong pa nyid nam mkha' dri ma med pa'i mthil nyid 'ba' zhig las dus gsum dang khams gsum pa rab tu gsal ba so so rang gis rig pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it arises from the characteristic of non-entity, that is, from the sole foundation of stainless space, the emptiness of non-entity, the self-cognizance of the three times and three realms arises.

original: rtsa ba 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: The root text will explain this:

original: nam mkha' las byung gzugs brnyan ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung gzugs brnyan ni //
translated: The reflection that arises from space

original: bsten pas bdag la de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsten pas bdag la de bzhin no //
translated: Is like that for me, through reliance.

original: zhes pa'o // 'gyur ba med pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba ni dngos po med min te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'gyur ba med pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba ni dngos po med min te /
translated: Unchanging, undefiled bliss is not a non-entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po las byung mtshan nyid phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po las byung mtshan nyid phyir te /
translated: Because it arises from the characteristic of entity.

original: rab tu gsal bar gyur pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las yang dag par phyung ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di yang // shes rab rgyu las ma skyes phyir //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar gyur pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las yang dag par phyung ba'i phyir ro // 'di yang // shes rab rgyu las ma skyes phyir //
translated: Because it is perfectly extracted from the entity that is the characteristic of form.🔽This is also clarified by the root text:

original: zhes pa la sgos pas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sgos pas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it does not arise from the cause of wisdom.

original: gang zhig g-yon pa steng du bgrod pa khu ba'i gzugs dngos po las 'jig rten dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig g-yon pa steng du bgrod pa khu ba'i gzugs dngos po las 'jig rten dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The one that moves upward on the left side is the form of semen, which is the opposite of ordinary things, and is the source of uncontaminated bliss.

original: stong pa nyid snying rje'i mtshan nyid la dngos po dang dngos po med pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid snying rje'i mtshan nyid la dngos po dang dngos po med pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Emptiness and compassion are characterized as being and nonbeing, respectively.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin 'di dag yang dag par sbyor te 'dus pa ni rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin 'di dag yang dag par sbyor te 'dus pa ni rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: These two, the natures of the conventional and ultimate truths, are perfectly united, and their union is the vajra yoga.

original: de yang gnyis med zung du 'jug pa dang / mi 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gnyis med zung du 'jug pa dang / mi 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: That is also called the nondual union and the unchanging.

original: 'di nyid de kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid de kho na'o //
translated: That is reality.

original: de 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Noble Haribhadra also says:

original: gang yang dag pa de de kho na'o //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa de de kho na'o //
translated: What is real is just that.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gang mi slu ba de yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gang mi slu ba de yang dag pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “What is real? What is nondeceptive is real.”

original: mi slu ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin de la mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin de la mi slu ba'o //
translated: What is this so-called non-deceptive? It is the concentration whose nature is the true mode.

original: gang yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gang bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi ting nge @285b 'dzin no //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gang bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can gyi ting nge @285b 'dzin no //
translated: What is this so-called concentration whose nature is the true mode? It is the concentration whose nature is the true mode that has the characteristic of the non-duality of the two truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das bden pa gnyis zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / dang po kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang gnyis pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bden pa gnyis zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / dang po kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang gnyis pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, what is this so-called duality of the two truths? The first is the conventional truth and the second is the ultimate truth.🔽Therefore,

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: gzugs dang gzugs min rnam par grol //🔽zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs min rnam par grol // zhes brjod de /
translated: “Liberated from form and non-form.”

original: phra phab pa na me long la sogs pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba'i lus la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med de rdul phra rab kyi tshogs 'dus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra phab pa na me long la sogs pa la dmigs par 'gyur ba'i lus la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med de rdul phra rab kyi tshogs 'dus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When reduced to subtle particles, the body does not have the characteristic of form in mirrors, etc., because it is not a collection of subtle particles.

original: gzugs min pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs min pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the characteristic of the formless,

original: dmigs par 'gyur ba bsnyon par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par 'gyur ba bsnyon par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to deny that it is an object.

original: de'i phyir gzugs ni srid pa 'khor bar mi long ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs ni srid pa 'khor bar mi long ste /
translated: Therefore, form does not go to samsara, existence,

original: 'gyur med mya ngan las 'das pa 'chad par mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gyur med mya ngan las 'das pa 'chad par mi 'gro'o //
translated: nor does it go to nirvana, the unconditioned.

original: phan tshun 'khyud pa zhi ba rnam 'gyur med pa ste dbang po'i rnam 'gyur dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'khyud pa zhi ba rnam 'gyur med pa ste dbang po'i rnam 'gyur dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The embrace of the two is peace, the absence of change, because it is free from the changes of the senses.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid 'di nyid ma ning go 'phang ste shes rab dan thabs 'ba' zhig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid 'di nyid ma ning go 'phang ste shes rab dan thabs 'ba' zhig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This very nature of both is the state of the neuter, because it is not just wisdom and method alone.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba ste 'gro ba mtha' dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba ste 'gro ba mtha' dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme is the best, because it is not common to all transmigrators.

original: phyag rgya chen po las yang dag par skyes pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyu nyid dang / phyag rgya chen po'i yang 'bras bu nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po las yang dag par skyes pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyu nyid dang / phyag rgya chen po'i yang 'bras bu nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the innate is the cause of the great seal and the great seal is the result of the innate, because it arises from the great seal?

original: de lta na ni gnyis po yang rgyu dang 'bras bu las ma 'das so //
analyzed: de lta na ni gnyis po yang rgyu dang 'bras bu las ma 'das so //
translated: In that case, both are not beyond cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya'am ye shes kyi phyag rgya rgyur gyur pa dang phyag rgya chen po la yang khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya'am ye shes kyi phyag rgya rgyur gyur pa dang phyag rgya chen po la yang khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, what is the difference between the karmamudra, the jnanamudra, and the mahamudra?

original: gsungs pa / shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said:

original: shes rab gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad pa rtogs pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi gzugs can ma ste de yang rgyu las ma skyes ma byung ba mi skye ba ste don dam par rang bzhin gyis ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad pa rtogs pa chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi gzugs can ma ste de yang rgyu las ma skyes ma byung ba mi skye ba ste don dam par rang bzhin gyis ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom is the form of all aspects, the realization of emptiness, the form of all phenomena, and that is also not born from a cause, not arisen, not produced, because ultimately it is not made by nature.🔽And also:

original: gang yang / shes rab rgyu las byung ba 'bras //
analyzed: gang yang / shes rab rgyu las byung ba 'bras //
translated: The wisdom is the result of the cause.

original: shes rab las skyes pa zhes brjod par bya ba de yang rgyu skyes min zhes pa shes rab kyi rgyu las skyes par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: shes rab las skyes pa zhes brjod par bya ba de yang rgyu skyes min zhes pa shes rab kyi rgyu las skyes par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: That which should be said to be born from wisdom is also not born from a cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab rgyu las ma skyes pa'i phyir te shes rab rgyu las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba yang 'dir ci ltar rgyu las skyes par 'gyur bar 'os 'di yin pa sngar nyid bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rgyu las ma skyes pa'i phyir te shes rab rgyu las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba yang 'dir ci ltar rgyu las skyes par 'gyur bar 'os 'di yin pa sngar nyid bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because wisdom is not produced from a cause. Since wisdom is not produced from a cause, the so-called coemergent result is not suitable to arise from a cause here, because this has already been refuted previously.

original: rgyu de'i phyir mi @286a * //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir mi @286a * //
translated: For that reason,

original: 'gyur ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de shes rab ye shes te rgyu las skyes pa min no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de shes rab ye shes te rgyu las skyes pa min no //
translated: that unchanging wisdom is wisdom, not produced from a cause.

original: de'i phyir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid kyis rgyu la rgyas btab pa'am rgyu nyid kyis 'bras bu la rgyas btab pa zhes pa gzhan dang gzhan du yang mi 'gyur la ;
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid kyis rgyu la rgyas btab pa'am rgyu nyid kyis 'bras bu la rgyas btab pa zhes pa gzhan dang gzhan du yang mi 'gyur la ;
translated: Therefore, because there is no relationship of cause and result, the seal of the result is not impressed on the cause, nor is the seal of the cause impressed on the result.

original: 'bras bus kyang rgyu la rgyas btab pa rgyus kyang 'bras bu la rgyas btab pa zhes pa phan tshun du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bus kyang rgyu la rgyas btab pa rgyus kyang 'bras bu la rgyas btab pa zhes pa phan tshun du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The seal of the result is not impressed on the cause, nor is the seal of the cause impressed on the result.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rgyu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Cause” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob pa dang de'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob pa dang de'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: Because cause and effect are dependently arisen, they are conventional. And because they are without beginning or end, they are supramundane.🔽Therefore, the two seals are inseparable, and this is called “union.”

original: de'i phyir phan tshun rgyas btab pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs /🔽skye min mya ngan 'das pa'ang min //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun rgyas btab pa gnyis ka dbyer med pa zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs / skye min mya ngan 'das pa'ang min //
translated: It is said:🔽Not arisen, not ceased,

original: zhes pa skye pa dang 'jig pa bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa skye pa dang 'jig pa bral ba'o //
translated: not annihilated, not eternal,🔽not come, not gone,🔽not different, not the same.🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Whether the Tathagatas arise or not, this dharmata of dharmas remains.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i gzugs kyi shes rab kyi cha dang por zhi ba nyid kyi phyir rtag tu skye ba med pa dang thabs kyi cha ni so so rang gi rig pa nyid kyi phyir rtag tu skye ba nyid de de'i phyir yang rgyu
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i gzugs kyi shes rab kyi cha dang por zhi ba nyid kyi phyir rtag tu skye ba med pa dang thabs kyi cha ni so so rang gi rig pa nyid kyi phyir rtag tu skye ba nyid de de'i phyir yang rgyu
translated: Since the aspect of the wisdom of form that is inseparable from both is🔽always non-arisen, and the aspect of method is always arisen because it is🔽individually self-aware, the cause is always present.🔽

original: dang 'bras bu med la phan tshun rgyas btab pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dang 'bras bu med la phan tshun rgyas btab pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because of the inseparability of the two, the aspect of wisdom, form, is originally peace, and therefore is always unborn. The aspect of method is individually self-knowing awareness, and therefore is always born. Therefore, there is no cause and effect, and there is no mutual sealing.

original: gzhan dang gzhan rgyas btab pa med pa'i rigs pa gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan rgyas btab pa med pa'i rigs pa gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: The reason for the absence of other and other sealing is stated:🔽Unborn,

original: ma skyes pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa las ldog pa'i phyi rol mi srid pa'i phyir rang gi sems nyid khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can des phyi rol gyi rnam par dbye ba dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa las ldog pa'i phyi rol mi srid pa'i phyir rang gi sems nyid khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can des phyi rol gyi rnam par dbye ba dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because external objects are impossible, apart from the aspects of consciousness, the mind itself, having the aspects of the three realms, is observed as the external divisions.

original: rang gi sems las gzhan ni ma yin te de'i tshe rnal 'byor ba la rang dang gzhan gyi cha'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems las gzhan ni ma yin te de'i tshe rnal 'byor ba la rang dang gzhan gyi cha'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not other than the mind, because at that time the yogin has no concepts of self and other.

original: kye'i rdo rjer yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rjer yang gsungs pa /
translated: Also, it is stated in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: mtho ris sa 'o gas steng rnams //
analyzed: mtho ris sa 'o gas steng rnams //
translated: The heavens and the earth

original: skad cig las ni sku gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig las ni sku gcig 'gyur //
translated: Become one body in an instant.

original: rang gzhan cha yi rnam rtog gis //
analyzed: rang gzhan cha yi rnam rtog gis //
translated: The concepts of self and other

original: gnod pa yis ni nus ma yin //🔽zhes pa'o // phyi yi shes bya rnams 'byed phyir //
analyzed: gnod pa yis ni nus ma yin // zhes pa'o // phyi yi shes bya rnams 'byed phyir //
translated: Are not able to harm.🔽In order to distinguish external objects

original: zhes pa phyi rol gyi shes bya tha dad du byed @286b pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa phyi rol gyi shes bya tha dad du byed @286b pa'o ;
translated: The external objects are differentiated.

original: / de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba ste ral gri zhes pa la sogs pa dpe'o //
analyzed: / de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba ste ral gri zhes pa la sogs pa dpe'o //
translated: Therefore, etc. is the summary. The sword, etc. is the example.

original: phyag rgya chen po skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu yang ma byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu yang ma byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Since the great seal is non-arisen, is not the effect also non-arisen?

original: skye ba med pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu 'ga' zhig kho na 'ga' zhig gis kyang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu 'ga' zhig kho na 'ga' zhig gis kyang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The effect of some non-arisen phenomenon is not experienced by anyone at all.🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / mo gsham zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / mo gsham zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The barren woman's son, etc.

original: ma skyes kyang mo gsham bu mo dang yang dag par sbyor bas rmi lam gyi dus su bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' las byung ba'i gzugs bsten pas 'bras bu lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i gzugs shes rab
analyzed: ma skyes kyang mo gsham bu mo dang yang dag par sbyor bas rmi lam gyi dus su bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' las byung ba'i gzugs bsten pas 'bras bu lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i gzugs shes rab
translated: Although it is not born, it is like a barren woman’s daughter, and because of being united with it, one experiences the taste of bliss at the time of the dream.🔽🔽In the same way, by relying on the form that arises from space, the form of connate bliss is known by wisdom.🔽

original: dang thabs kyi dbang po las ma skyes pa phyag rgya chen po las yang dag par skyes pa nam mkha' bzhin du sgrib pa spangs pa 'byung po thams cad la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang rig par bya ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: dang thabs kyi dbang po las ma skyes pa phyag rgya chen po las yang dag par skyes pa nam mkha' bzhin du sgrib pa spangs pa 'byung po thams cad la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang rig par bya ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: Just as a barren woman’s daughter, though not born, is united with a dream man and experiences bliss during the dream, in the same way, the form that arises from space is the form of innate bliss, which arises from mahāmudrā, not born from the faculties of wisdom and method, and like space, it is free of obscurations, present in all beings, and is to be known by yogins and yoginīs as reflexive awareness alone.

original: de kho na ma rig pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na ma rig pa rnams kyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be known by those who are ignorant of reality.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched med na dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba dang bral ba ni shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched med na dbang po gnyis yang dag par sbyor ba dang bral ba ni shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there are no aggregates, elements, or sense bases, then the union of the two faculties is absent, and the wisdom of the gnosis of the mudra will not be reflexive awareness.

original: 'pho ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Hasn’t the Tathāgata said that there is no transference?

original: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba la rang gi sems kyi rjes su chags par byas nas rang gi sems sgrib pa med par byed cing mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyang longs spyod par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba la rang gi sems kyi rjes su chags par byas nas rang gi sems sgrib pa med par byed cing mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyang longs spyod par byed de /
translated: How does the yogin, having made his mind follow his mind’s appearances, make his mind free from obscurations and also enjoy the pristine awareness of supreme, unchanging bliss?

original: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i lus med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i lus med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no body that is a collection of atoms.

original: 'di nyid ni phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: This is a mistake.

original: lha sbyin rang nyid kyi phrag par zhon nas grong du 'gro'o zhes pa'i tshig bzhin no zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig gis bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha sbyin rang nyid kyi phrag par zhon nas grong du 'gro'o zhes pa'i tshig bzhin no zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig gis bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It’s like the expression “Devadatta rides on his own shoulders and goes to town.”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: So, we will explain this.

original: 'dir gang rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ma gtogs pa sems tsam gyis shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gang rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ma gtogs pa sems tsam gyis shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not the case that, apart from the aggregates, elements, and media, which are the nature of a collection of subtle atoms, the mind alone is not the self-knowing wisdom of the mind, as the ignorant would have it.

original: bag chags so //
analyzed: bag chags so //
translated: It is the habitual tendency.

original: 'dir phung po khams dang skye mched ces bya ba ni glo bung ba'i sems kyi bag chags @287a * //
analyzed: 'dir phung po khams dang skye mched ces bya ba ni glo bung ba'i sems kyi bag chags @287a * //
translated: Here, the aggregates, elements, and media are the habitual tendencies of the mind, which is a mass of error.

original: so ; / de'i drin gyis sems la bde ba dang sdug bsngal sems kyi bag chags rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: so ; / de'i drin gyis sems la bde ba dang sdug bsngal sems kyi bag chags rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: By its grace, the habitual tendencies of pleasure and pain enter the mind.

original: don dam par rnam par dpyad na lus 'di'i nye bar 'tshe ba phran tshogs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par rnam par dpyad na lus 'di'i nye bar 'tshe ba phran tshogs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: When ultimately analyzed, it is not the case that the body is harmed by a multitude of minor harms.

original: 'dir rdul phra rab tshogs ba'i bdag nyid kyis lus ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rab tu lhung ste gnas shing 'di'i nye bar 'tshe ba phran tshegs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na gang gis sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug //
analyzed: 'dir rdul phra rab tshogs ba'i bdag nyid kyis lus ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rab tu lhung ste gnas shing 'di'i nye bar 'tshe ba phran tshegs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na gang gis sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug //
translated: Here, the body, which is by nature a collection of subtle particles, falls asleep in the dream state and remains there. If there is no harm at all to this body, then how does suffering enter the mind?

original: 'dir 'jig rten thams cad du rab tu grags pa gnas skabs de nyid na sems kyi bag chags kyi bdag nyid kyi lus gzhan rdul phra rab tshogs pa dang bral ba yul gzhan du 'gro bar rab tu snang ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten thams cad du rab tu grags pa gnas skabs de nyid na sems kyi bag chags kyi bdag nyid kyi lus gzhan rdul phra rab tshogs pa dang bral ba yul gzhan du 'gro bar rab tu snang ste /
translated: Here, in that very state, which is well known to everyone, the body, which is by nature a mental imprint, is seen to go to another place, free from the collection of subtle particles.

original: yul gzhan du song ba de'i lus la chom rkun la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar 'tshe ba byas par gyur pa na nye bar 'tshe ba des sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug cing sdug bsngal des du bar byed de /
analyzed: yul gzhan du song ba de'i lus la chom rkun la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar 'tshe ba byas par gyur pa na nye bar 'tshe ba des sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug cing sdug bsngal des du bar byed de /
translated: When the body in that other place is harmed by thieves and so on, then that harm enters the mind as suffering and one cries out in pain.

original: lus med cing chom rkun la sogs pa med par sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi shes pa rang rig par bya ba rab tu 'jug pa 'di de rmad du byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: lus med cing chom rkun la sogs pa med par sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi shes pa rang rig par bya ba rab tu 'jug pa 'di de rmad du byung ba chen po'o //
translated: The mind’s suffering, which is to be known by itself, is engaged without a body and without thieves, etc. This is a great wonder.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam du 'dod pa chen po nye bar longs spyod pa rnams kyis sems la bde ba rab tu 'jug ste lus med cing 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa rnams nges par sems can rnams kyi sems kyi bde ba'i shes pa rang rig par
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam du 'dod pa chen po nye bar longs spyod pa rnams kyis sems la bde ba rab tu 'jug ste lus med cing 'dod pa nye bar longs spyod pa rnams nges par sems can rnams kyi sems kyi bde ba'i shes pa rang rig par
translated: In the same way, the mind’s pleasure, which is engaged by the enjoyment of great pleasures in a dream, without a body and without the enjoyment of pleasures, is definitely the mind’s pleasure of sentient beings, which is to be known by itself.

original: bya ba rab tu 'jug pa de ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bya ba rab tu 'jug pa de ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: This is a great wonder.

original: nyi tshe ba'i shes pa 'di nyid kyang mkhas pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par mi nus na 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnal 'byor pa'i kun du bzang po mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i ye
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i shes pa 'di nyid kyang mkhas pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par mi nus na 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnal 'byor pa'i kun du bzang po mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po'i ye
translated: If even this limited knowledge cannot be analyzed by the wise, then how much less can the all-good, unchanging great bliss of the yogi/nī, which transcends the habitual tendencies of saṃsāra and arises from the habitual tendencies of nirvāṇa, be analyzed?

original: shes rang rig par bya ba rmongs pa rnams kyis rnam par brtag par mi nus pa lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rang rig par bya ba rmongs pa rnams kyis rnam par brtag par mi nus pa lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: What need is there to say that the ignorant are not able to imagine the self-knowing wisdom?

original: gal te shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa zhes brjod pa de yang don dam pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa zhes brjod pa de yang don dam pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the inseparability of wisdom and method is not the ultimate,🔽it is said:

original: gsungs pa / shes rab ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / shes rab ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not wisdom, not method,” and so on.

original: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min na tha dad du gyur pa'i phung po yod na gang gis de dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems su 'gyur te gnas skabs de gyis pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis rnam par @287b shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min na tha dad du gyur pa'i phung po yod na gang gis de dbyer med pa byang chub kyi sems su 'gyur te gnas skabs de gyis pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis rnam par @287b shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir
translated: If there is a separate aggregate of wisdom and method, by what is that inseparability made into the mind of enlightenment? Because it is not known by the yogis who are in that state.

original: ro // lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa yang shes rab blo dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyi phyir brjod do //
analyzed: ro // lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa yang shes rab blo dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyi phyir brjod do //
translated: It is also called “coemergent” because it is coemergent with the wisdom mind.

original: kun nas bde ba rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs thob pa la sgrib pa thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya la sogs pa sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas bde ba rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs thob pa la sgrib pa thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya la sogs pa sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The state of the attainment of complete bliss is the freedom from all obscurations, such as the afflictions of desire, etc., and from all obscurations, such as the knowable, etc.

original: gos med ni lag pa la sogs pas reg tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos med ni lag pa la sogs pas reg tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not covered because it cannot be touched by hands, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir lus dang dbang po spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir lus dang dbang po spangs pa'o //
translated: It is free from body and sense faculties because it is free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: thams cad la yongs su khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir kun nas so //
analyzed: thams cad la yongs su khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir kun nas so //
translated: It is all-pervading because it pervades everything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung po kun la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung po kun la gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the abode of all beings because it is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dus gsum la yang ngo //🔽rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa mi shes pa'i gri gug gis gcad du med pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum la yang ngo // rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa mi shes pa'i gri gug gis gcad du med pa'o //
translated: It is the three times.🔽It is not cut by the sword of ignorance because it transcends the nature of subtle particles.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dbyer med pa nyid las dbye ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las 'das pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dbyer med pa nyid las dbye ba spangs pa'o //
translated: It is free from division because it is indivisible from the apprehended object and apprehending subject, because it transcends the nature of consciousness.

original: rang 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dpa' drug mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dpa' drug mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The three verses beginning with “self-arisen” are a brief presentation of the six supramundane heroes.

original: ma skyes ma 'gags pa'i phyir rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes ma 'gags pa'i phyir rang 'byung ngo //
translated: It is self-arisen because it is unborn and unceasing.

original: 'gro ba'i don byed pa nyid kyi phyir don chen no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byed pa nyid kyi phyir don chen no //
translated: It is the great meaning because it performs the purpose of beings.

original: gsang ba la sogs pa'i gtsug tor gyi mthar thug pa 'khor lo drug tu rim pas rdo rje sems dpa' dang sems dpa' chen po dang byang chub sems dpa' dang dam tshig sems dpa' dang rdo rje rnal 'byor dang dus kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba drug go
analyzed: gsang ba la sogs pa'i gtsug tor gyi mthar thug pa 'khor lo drug tu rim pas rdo rje sems dpa' dang sems dpa' chen po dang byang chub sems dpa' dang dam tshig sems dpa' dang rdo rje rnal 'byor dang dus kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba drug go
translated: The six are Vajrasattva, Mahāsattva, Bodhisattva, Samayasattva, Vajrayogin, and Kālacakra, respectively, in the six cakras from the secret cakra up to the uṣṇīṣa cakra.

original: // 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is the vajra, etc.

original: rdo rje stong pa'i gzugs te gang gi phyir de mi phyed pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje stong pa'i gzugs te gang gi phyir de mi phyed pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra is the form of emptiness, because it is indivisible.

original: don chen ni chen po mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don chen ni chen po mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The great meaning is the brief presentation of the great.

original: sems dpa' ni gang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bo lus dang ngag dang sems rnams gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' ni gang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bo lus dang ngag dang sems rnams gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The hero is the identity of body, speech, and mind, the nature of the desire realm and so forth.

original: de ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: That is the brief indication of the supreme unchanging.

original: yang na rdo rje ni gang mi phyed pa sku dang gsung dang thugs ro gcig pa ste bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni gang mi phyed pa sku dang gsung dang thugs ro gcig pa ste bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //
translated: Or, the vajra is the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind, the gnosis of great bliss.

original: sems dpa' srid gsum gcig pa nyid //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid gsum gcig pa nyid //
translated: The hero is the identity of the three existences.

original: ces bya'o // 'di dag gcig pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba ste chen po ni bde ba chen po rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽'dod chags chen po @288a * //
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'di dag gcig pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba ste chen po ni bde ba chen po rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'dod chags chen po @288a * //
translated: Their identity is the supreme unchanging. Great is because of the perfection of great bliss.

original: ni mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ni mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: Great passion is the brief indication.

original: de yang sems dpa' sa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sems dpa' sa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because the hero is the perfection of the stage.

original: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa ni mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa ni mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The one who delights all sentient beings is the brief indication.

original: yang na gang zhig chen po sgras 'dir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ste de dang sems dpa' sa rnams kyi rdzogs pa gang yin pa de sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: yang na gang zhig chen po sgras 'dir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ste de dang sems dpa' sa rnams kyi rdzogs pa gang yin pa de sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: Or else, he is a great being, since he is the perfection of that supreme unchanging bliss, which is called “great” here, and of the stages of the bodhisattva.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni byang chub stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid chos kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa ni mi g-yo bar gnas pa ste nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhe sdang gi tshogs rnams las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni byang chub stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i bdag nyid chos kyi 'khor lo la gnas pa ni mi g-yo bar gnas pa ste nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhe sdang gi tshogs rnams las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a bodhisattva, since he is established in the wheel of the Dharma, which is the essence of emptiness and compassion, and is established without wavering, because he is victorious over the hosts of hatred, which are the nature of the afflictions, and so forth.

original: zhe sdang chen po dgra che ba yang mdor bstan pa ste de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang chen po dgra che ba yang mdor bstan pa ste de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: He is a bodhisattva, because he is the great hatred, the great enemy, as was briefly indicated.

original: dam tshig ni 'dus pa ste zla ba bdud rtsi'i khu ba'i bde ba 'pho ba med pa'i ngo bo zab ste gti mug las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig ni 'dus pa ste zla ba bdud rtsi'i khu ba'i bde ba 'pho ba med pa'i ngo bo zab ste gti mug las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge is the assembly, which is profound, since it is the essence of the bliss of the nectar of the moon, which is the unmoving bliss, because it is victorious over delusion.

original: gti mug chen po gti mug blo can rnams kyi gti mug gti mug gsod par byed pa yang mdor bstan pa de'i phyir dam tshig sems dpa'o //🔽gang gi phyir de nyid sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams kyi shes rab gzugs dang mi 'gyur ba'i thig le rnams dang bcas pa gcig tu sbyor ba las gcig pa nyid ni khro bo las nges par rgyal ba khro bo chen po ste bdud las rnam par
analyzed: gti mug chen po gti mug blo can rnams kyi gti mug gti mug gsod par byed pa yang mdor bstan pa de'i phyir dam tshig sems dpa'o // gang gi phyir de nyid sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams kyi shes rab gzugs dang mi 'gyur ba'i thig le rnams dang bcas pa gcig tu sbyor ba las gcig pa nyid ni khro bo las nges par rgyal ba khro bo chen po ste bdud las rnam par
translated: The great delusion, the delusion of the deluded, the delusion-killer, is also the pledge-being, because of the brief indication.

original: rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that very one is the single union of the vajras of body, etc., together with the wisdoms, the forms, and the unchanging vital drops, the single one is the great wrathful one, the conqueror of wrath, because of the complete victory over the demon.

original: khro bo'i bdud rnams kyi dgra yang mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: khro bo'i bdud rnams kyi dgra yang mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The enemy of the demons of wrath is also the brief indication, thus is the vajra yoga.

original: gang gi phyir rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bde ba chen po de ni dus te thabs de las mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don yongs su mi 'dor ba ni 'khor lo zhes bya ste bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bde ba chen po de ni dus te thabs de las mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don yongs su mi 'dor ba ni 'khor lo zhes bya ste bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Since that very great bliss, the vajra yoga, is the time, the wheel is called from that method, because of the non-abandonment of the welfare of infinite sentient beings, the Bhagavān.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sems can grol nas chags chen po //
analyzed: sems can grol nas chags chen po //
translated: liberating sentient beings, the great passion,

original: 'gyur ba'i chags pa sel bar byed kyang mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i chags pa sel bar byed kyang mdor bstan pa'o zhes pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The one who removes the attachment to change is the Kālacakra.

original: rtsa drug gi rang bzhin rtsibs drug pa'i 'khor lo la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa 'di rnams so sor rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rtsa drug gi rang bzhin rtsibs drug pa'i 'khor lo la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa 'di rnams so sor rnam pa drug go //
translated: In the six-spoked wheel, which is of the nature of the six nāḍīs, these, Vajrasattva and so on, are each sixfold.

original: de la dung can ma'i rang bzhin 'og gi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la dung can ma'i rang bzhin 'og gi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes so //
translated: There, on the lower spoke, which is of the nature of the “hairy one” (śaṇṭhinī), is unchanging wisdom.

original: ra sa n'a'i rang bzhin lho'i rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: ra sa n'a'i rang bzhin lho'i rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: On the southern spoke, which is of the nature of the rasanā, is unchanging feeling.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin steng gi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //🔽bshang ba'i @288b rtsa'i rang bzhin nub kyi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin steng gi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i rnam par shes pa'o // bshang ba'i @288b rtsa'i rang bzhin nub kyi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i gzugs so //
translated: On the upper spoke, which is of the nature of the avadhūti, is unchanging consciousness.🔽On the western spoke, which is of the nature of the feces nāḍī, is unchanging form.

original: gci ba'i rtsa'i rang bzhin shar gyi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i 'du byed do //🔽la la n'a'i rang bzhin byang gi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i 'du shes so zhes pa phung po drug rnams so //
analyzed: gci ba'i rtsa'i rang bzhin shar gyi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i 'du byed do //🔽la la n'a'i rang bzhin byang gi rtsibs la mi 'gyur ba'i 'du shes so zhes pa phung po drug rnams so //
translated: On the eastern spoke, which is of the nature of the urine nāḍī, are unchanging compositional factors.🔽On the northern spoke, which is of the nature of the lalanā, is unchanging discrimination.

original: rigs drug po de rnams nyid rim pa ji lta bar mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes la sogs pa khams drug rnams kyi'o //🔽de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i yid la sogs pa'i dbang po drug po rnams dang / de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i sgra la sogs pa'i yul drug po rnams dang / dbang pos nye bar mtshon nas mi 'gyur ba'i mchog gi dbang po dang lag pa dang gci ba'i lam dang bshang lam dang ngag dang rkang pa zhes bya ba las kyi dbang po rnams dang /
analyzed: rigs drug po de rnams nyid rim pa ji lta bar mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes la sogs pa khams drug rnams kyi'o // de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i yid la sogs pa'i dbang po drug po rnams dang / de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i sgra la sogs pa'i yul drug po rnams dang / dbang pos nye bar mtshon nas mi 'gyur ba'i mchog gi dbang po dang lag pa dang gci ba'i lam dang bshang lam dang ngag dang rkang pa zhes bya ba las kyi dbang po rnams dang /
translated: These six families are the six constituents beginning with unchanging bliss.🔽Similarly, they are the six faculties beginning with the unchanging mind, the six objects beginning with unchanging sound, and the six action faculties beginning with the unchanging supreme faculty, hands, anus, penis, speech, and feet.

original: de bzhin du yul gyis nye bar mtshon nas mi 'gyur ba'i khu ba 'pho ba dang len pa dang gci ba 'dzag pa dang bshang ba 'dzag pa dang brjod pa dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gyis nye bar mtshon nas mi 'gyur ba'i khu ba 'pho ba dang len pa dang gci ba 'dzag pa dang bshang ba 'dzag pa dang brjod pa dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Similarly, they are the six actions of the action faculties beginning with the emission and retention of unchanging semen, the emission of feces and urine, speech, and walking.

original: sum cu rtsa drug po 'di rnams kyang rim pas dkyil 'khor la ste 'dod pa chen po zhes bya ba rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ba rin chen dbang po dang khro bo chen po zhes bya ba mi bskyod pa dang /🔽gti mug chen po zhes bya ba rnam par snang mdzad dang / zhe sdang chen po zhes bya ba don yod grub pa dang / chags pa chen po zhes bya ba 'od dpag med dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma gos dkar mo rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug po 'di rnams kyang rim pas dkyil 'khor la ste 'dod pa chen po zhes bya ba rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ba rin chen dbang po dang khro bo chen po zhes bya ba mi bskyod pa dang / gti mug chen po zhes bya ba rnam par snang mdzad dang / zhe sdang chen po zhes bya ba don yod grub pa dang / chags pa chen po zhes bya ba 'od dpag med dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma gos dkar mo rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma /
translated: These thirty-six are in sequence in the mandala: Vajrasattva, called “great desire,” Ratnasambhava, called “great passion,” Akṣobhya, called “great wrath,”🔽Vairocana, called “great stupidity,” Amoghasiddhi, called “great hatred,” Amitābha, called “great attachment,” and Vajradhātvīśvarī, called “great pristine consciousness.”

original: spyan ma / sgrol ma /🔽m'a ma k'i rnams dang / kun du bzang po /
analyzed: spyan ma / sgrol ma / m'a ma k'i rnams dang / kun du bzang po /
translated: The goddesses are Pāṇḍaravāsinī, called “great wisdom,” Locanā, called “great body,” Tārā, called “great speech,”🔽and Māmakī, called “great mind.”

original: sa'i snying po /
analyzed: sa'i snying po /
translated: The bodhisattvas are Samantabhadra, called “great faith,”🔽Kṣitigarbha, called “great diligence,”

original: phyag na rdo rje /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, called “great mindfulness,”

original: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba /🔽nam mkha'i snying po /🔽'jig rten dbang phyug rnams dang / sgra rdo rje ma /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba / nam mkha'i snying po / 'jig rten dbang phyug rnams dang / sgra rdo rje ma /
translated: Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, called “great concentration,”🔽Ākāśagarbha, called “great wisdom,”🔽and Avalokiteśvara, called “great method.”

original: ro rdo rje ma /
analyzed: ro rdo rje ma /
translated: The goddesses are Śabdavajrā, called “great form,” Rasavajrā, called “great sound,”🔽Dhātūvajrā, called “great smell,” Sparśavajrā, called “great touch,”

original: chos dbyings rdo rje ma /
analyzed: chos dbyings rdo rje ma /

original: gzugs rdo rje ma rnams dang / gnod mdzes /

original: gshin rje mthar byed /

analyzed: bgegs mthar byed /

original: padma mthar byed rnams //

original: shin tu sngon mo /
analyzed: shin tu sngon mo /

original: rengs byed ma /
analyzed: rengs byed ma /

original: brtson 'grus chen mo /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo /

original: khengs byed ma rnams so //🔽lha sum cu rtsa drug la khyab par byed pa bsam du @289a * //
analyzed: khengs byed ma rnams so // lha sum cu rtsa drug la khyab par byed pa bsam du @289a * //
translated: and mānanī.

original: med pa'i thugs rdo rje 'di yang sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gog pa'i phyir khro bo'i rgyal po ste /
analyzed: med pa'i thugs rdo rje 'di yang sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gog pa'i phyir khro bo'i rgyal po ste /
translated: The thirty-six deities are pervaded by the inconceivable mind-vajra, which is the king of wrathful ones because it stops attachment and so on, which are associated with obscurations.

original: 'dod pa chen po la sogs pa gdong drug po 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa rnams 'jigs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'jigs byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa chen po la sogs pa gdong drug po 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa rnams 'jigs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'jigs byed ces pa ste /
translated: It is called Bhairava because it terrifies the māras of the lord of death and so on, who have six faces, such as Mahārati and so on.

original: brjod pa'i ye shes la sogs pa rigs drug rnams kyi tshul gyi yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i ye shes la sogs pa rigs drug rnams kyi tshul gyi yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the complete purity of the six families, such as Vāgīśvara and so on.

original: mdor bstan pas ni mdor bsdus te gsal bar bshad do zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pas ni mdor bsdus te gsal bar bshad do zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what the Bhagavān said.

original: dag pa don dam gsal byed pa //
analyzed: dag pa don dam gsal byed pa //
translated: The pure ultimate is clarified.

original: sgrib dang mun pa thams cad 'joms //
analyzed: sgrib dang mun pa thams cad 'joms //
translated: It conquers all obscurations and darkness.

original: 'gro ba'i gdung 'phrog 'di ni dbang //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gdung 'phrog 'di ni dbang //
translated: This is the water that steals the heat of beings.

original: mdor bstan zla ba'i zla 'od do //
analyzed: mdor bstan zla ba'i zla 'od do //
translated: This is the concise explanation, the moonlight.

original: zhes pa dbang mdor bstan pa'i 'grel bshad don dam pa bsdus pa zhes bya ba phyag rgya chen po grub pa'i slob dpon dpal n'a ro'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhes pa dbang mdor bstan pa'i 'grel bshad don dam pa bsdus pa zhes bya ba phyag rgya chen po grub pa'i slob dpon dpal n'a ro'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the concise explanation of the empowerment called “The Compendium of the Ultimate,” composed by the master of mahāmudrā siddhi, the glorious Nāropa.

original: // / kha che'i pandi ta dharm'a dha ra dang / lo ts'a ba grags pa rgyal mtshan gyis bal po'i mthil du bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: // / kha che'i pandi ta dharm'a dha ra dang / lo ts'a ba grags pa rgyal mtshan gyis bal po'i mthil du bsgyur ba las /
translated: It was translated from the Newārī language into the language of Kashmir by the Kashmiri paṇḍita Dharmadatta and the translator Drakpa Gyaltsen.

original: slar yang legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis brda sprod ba'i tshul rigs pa rin chen rgyal mtshan gyis dpal sa skya'i chos grva chen por legs par bsgyur cing zhus te dag par byas pa'o /
analyzed: slar yang legs par sbyar ba'i skad kyis brda sprod ba'i tshul rigs pa rin chen rgyal mtshan gyis dpal sa skya'i chos grva chen por legs par bsgyur cing zhus te dag par byas pa'o /
translated: Later, the translator Rikpé Rinchen Gyaltsen revised it well, and it was corrected and finalized at the great Dharma seat of glorious Sakya.
